content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
It was a long time ago.2002. GTA: VC is coming out.This was a game way ahead of its time. If GTA III was, no doubt, a breakthrough, it wasn't that perfect.Vice City, on the other hand, was. The main change of time and place was spot on. Miami, 80's, blood, drugs, sex and rock'n'roll.With combination like that it couldn't go wrong, and it didn't. Polishing the predecessor's engine and graphics, VC expanded everything: map, weapons, cars, abilities and so much more. But the most important part was that it did it more subtle than San Andreas, for example.To have this kind of freedom and variety in the open world game was completely mindblowing 14 years ago.And I still think that this is and probably always will be the best GTA game for me.-Hey, member, member Vice City? -Mmm, yes, I member!The story is a classic from-bottom-to-the-top-Scarface-like journey. And although it's nothing spectacular, all well-written characters, funny lines of dialogue and memorable missions made it special.Just take a look at what kind of jobs were there and tell me you don't miss it:- Explode a building with RC helicopter- Dress as a cop and plant a bomb at the mall- Steal a ♥♥♥♥ing tank in a broad daylight from main street- Produce and promote your own porn movie- Jump between two skyscrapers on a bike- Fight off a french army on a boat- Join the gang, start a war, join the other gang, repeat- Buy an ice-cream truck and sell dope from itDon't forget the first massive Bank Heist with several preparation missions beforehand.♫"...keep feeling fascination"The absolute classic, Vice City will forever pass the test of time for me.Nostalgic, colorful, warm and welcoming city.Dangerous, unforgiving and corrupt city.City of love, hate, awesome music, politics, gangwars, drugs, criminals and ♥♥♥♥♥s.City of opportunity, quintessence of the American Dream.The city you want to come back to sometimes.Vice City.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Ignore my steam playtime, i've played this for hundreds of hours back in the day.-----------Grand Theft Auto: Vice City, released in 2002. It was set in 1986 in Vice City (Fictional name for Miami Beach, Florida, i guess it's not hard to tell). A game that is still one of the greatest games of this era, in 2003 everyone was crazy about it. You can judge if this is a masterpiece or not by just looking at it's popularity even nowadays, how many games that are 11 years old are still played today? Not many. The atmosphere you find in this game is perfect, your ears are delighted with great tracks from: Michael Jackson (Never liked him, but he had some great tracks), Megadeth, Anthrax, Cutting Crew, The Whispers, The Outfield, Bryan Adams, Iron Maiden, Loverboy, Slayer, Judas Priest, even Frankie goes to Hollywood, and the list goes on more of course.The graphics were absolutely amazing at the time of release. Gameplay was, and still is great, the mechanics are friendly. You ave a variety of weapons to choose from when it comes to slaughtering random people on the street, including hookers and old ladies. The cars you find in this game, are mostly sport ones, you also can find scooters and motorbikes.You play as Tommy Vercetti, a mafia member that just got out of the prison. You are involved in a deal that gone wrong and you need to find the people who 'backstabbed' you'. In my opinion, this is the greatest GTA game released, shame that GTA V kinda 'dodged' the actual GTA feeling there once was, but hey, we have to move forward!. I would love to see a GTA: Vice City remake, nonetheless.As for the technical stuff about this game. It works on Windows 8.1 flawlessly, without any compatibility options set, or any patch or modification. It recognizes new resolutions (1440x900 user here). A perfect game that gave me hundreds hours of fun many years ago.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2014
												Vice City is probably the best GTA that has been made to date. Obviously, as a PC gamer, this opinion does not include GTA V as that one was never released by Rockstar on my favourite platform. I personally liked GTA IV a lot and the reviews on the latest installment were very promising - I just think Vice City was more captivating than the rest.Vice City looks dated, yes. Please bear in mind that this is an eleven year old game and considering the capacity of our smart phones this game is accessible as an Android application as the game's engine can easily be handled by our phones' hardware. Its atmosphere, however, is still captivating even a decade after its release so playing such an "old" game on a widescreen monitor with next-gen hardware is no shame!You play as Tommy Vercetti (voice by Ray Liotta) and you are in the '80s. You have cars, music and even film references from this era. Some scenes remind you of Miami Vice while others are clearly a nod to Pacino's character in Scarface. How cool is that?You have dozens of missions available. Some continue the main story while other are just side missions. Each includes a cutscene with amazing voice acting so it is a crime to skip any of the available missions. Oh, you don't want to do any of these? No problem: Vice City allows the player to just cruise in the city, steal cars, crash these cars, harass citizens (with these cars, too). You can drive a cab and earn some money at your leisure. Or steal a police car and become the terminator of vigilantes.There are tons of things to do in GTA. And while Vice City is certainly an outdated game nothing else out there can remind you how cool the '80s were than this piece of treasure.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
OverviewDespite its age, Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is still an extremely fun game. I have played every GTA game to date and despite my love for Grand Theft Auto 5, I still prefer Vice City and in the paragraphs below I will attempt to explain why.A Good Starting PointI love GTA 3. The game has quite a lot of enjoyable gameplay and during my most recent playthrough, I didn't have too many issues (besides the races), which was fairly impressive for a game of its age. This certainly does nor mean the game is amazing. In 2016 the game is both a bit clunky and also lacking aesthetic wise. The game was a good starting point and a great transition from the 2D gameplay of old into the 3D realm we know today. I understand how revolutionary GTA 3 was, however looking back in 2016 with the incredible GTA 5 out as well as some decent competitors such as Watch Dogs 2 and Mafia 3, GTA 3 doesn't stand up as well as it used to. Vice City (in my opion) does.Standing Up to Modern Open-World GamesOpen worlds are getting bigger and bigger as both time and hardware move forward. In an era full of games with huge landscapes that take hours to explore, revisiting Vice City was very refreshing. It takes about 10 minutes maximum to traverse the map and that is without counting for the race cars which can be found around every corner. I feel I have to truly get into a game in order to play it nowadays. You can't just sit down, do a quick mission and then leave again. This is mostly personal but a lot of Vice City's charm comes with its simplicity, in my eyes at least. Of course, the game isn't "simple" as I put it but compared to modern open world games it's far from complex; thats why I love the game. It's so easy just to do a few missions, save and quit. I think if the game tried to be complex it would've been left in the dust as time went by, but the games simplistic charm is what truly makes it timeless.GameplayAiming/ShootingMy main quarrel with this game is it's aiming mechanics and this is stemmed from the lack of over the shoulder aiming. Shooting accurately in third person is a pain. Let's say you have someone directly in front of you that you need to shoot. You aim your crosshair at them, but due to the camera angle, this makes you look at the ground missing your target. Instead, you aim above the target so you shoot straight in front of you (in theory). You shoot into the sky. This is quite easily fixed by scoping with the Assult Rifles however that makes 2/3s of weapons redundant. This is mainly a sign of age, however, the Assult Rifles spoke of earlier are not hard to find.Driving/FlyingDriving is very smooth for keyboard and mouse and is both playable and enjoyable. The flying is rather hard to get used to. In the modern day, it is rather rare to use the num pad to control anything let alone something as complex as a helicopter. It is very hard to control at first, however, upon getting used to can be fun to use. Boats are ok but a bit odd due to the physics engine.PhysicsThe physics engine for this game is both a bit clunky and also glitchy due to its age, however it is rare to have an issue with it in normal gameplay. Cars occasionally slide upon collision and some bigger vehicles can seem weightless and tip over but these issues are rare.The Story and MissionsThe story follows Tommy Vercetti as he is forced into the crime underworld of Vice City, a Miami-inspired metropolis filled to the brim with gangs, drugs and greed. You, through the eyes of Tommy, rise up through the criminal world and slowly build your empire gradually making more and more money. Admittedly the story can be a bit cheesy and predictable but this fits the pumped up 80s action film tropes that this game likes to both mock and mimic. Most missions are fun and interesting. You can go from stealing a phone from a gang of chefs to blowing up part of a mall and attempting to escape with a 5-star wanted level. Of course, a few missions are difficult and require multiple runs, but that just adds playtime.The EndThank you for reading my review. At the price this game goes for, I would recommend you pick it up. Who knows you might just fall in love all over again.

content:
Posted: March 30
												Some time ago I was reviewing GTA 3 and said it's still a classy and enjoyable product, even by todays standards. Well, I wasn't lying, but I know that the industry have made a huge leap forward since the times of the GTA 3 release. Honestly saying, even the GTA V is not an absolute king of the day at moment. It's just a one great game from the row. But, it's a progress which is really much obliged for everything to the GTA 3, Vice City and San Andreas games. Those titles are like cornerstones of the great skyscraper of the gaming industry and the milestones for its progress altogether.Oh, anyway, let's cut short to the game already, yeah?The top selling points of the Vice city, are - the spirit of 80's, with music, cars and everything, and the cunning story, with the main character who's not just some random guy like Claude from GTA 3 or people before him. Those things are good and touching even now. Jeez, I love the 80's! And I love the Vice City game!Yeah, by the time it was released, there was some more things to talk about. Like the weather visual effects, addition of bikes, and some more things - all of them was mind-blowing then, but seems standard issue now. Even the furious missions like "the Demo man", where you need to blow things with RC models, while using quite the challenging controls and time limits to do so - now seems as usual stuff as well. I bet many drone operators in the US who are using the real deal Predators somewhere in the Afghanistan, have started with the GTA RC missions...But, if you're now wandering, if the GTA Vice City is still an option to play, and what's for, I'll answer you: Yes, for it's the blast from the past, with the whole set of things we're love 80s for. And yeah, it's quite playable, after you tune yourself with controls a bit.So, my mark is 8.5/10, and I recommend the game for everyone.

content:
Posted: February 21
												I absolutely 100% recommend this game to anyone wanting to get into the older GTAs. It's a great starting point as it has better gameplay than GTAIII and quality of life features. It's story and presentation have aged like fine wine, the voice actors and performances are also great, and it was the starting point of where GTA started getting it's own identity in terms of presentation and stories.There is one huge caveat though, if you think you're going to just buy this game on Steam and enjoy yourself, you're badly mistaken honestly. Rockstar's previous efforts of putting GTA on PC were absolutely laughable in comparison to where they are now with GTAV, which is an awesome version of the game. Vice City is one of the most annoying video game experiences I've had just out of the box, so I've spent some time modding the game. My recommendation is based off my experience with Vice City with 3 Essential mods installed and honestly only buy this game if you're going to mod the game with these 3 mods.- Ginput (Fixes basic PC controls to a more modern/natural feel, as well as adds XInput functionality. ALSO WORKS FOR SA AND 3)- GTAVC Widescreen Fix (A quick internet search of this mod will bring you to the correct site where there is support for San Andreas, ViceCity, and GTA 3)- SilentPatch (Fixes a TON of issues, just download it)Vice City is an outstanding game that I think must be experienced in this day and age, it's outstanding theme, radio soundtrack and characters make it impossible to forget after experiencing it, and it's a stepping stone in Rockstar's legacy.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2016
												So you might be asking why review a game that originally came out in 2002/2003? Well to this day it is still my favorite game. Nothing has come close to beating it and i don’t think anything ever will. There’s been a lot of controversy over the years about the Grand Theft Auto games, and their potential effects on children; so, this is probably a bad time to mention that I first played Vice City when I was quite young. But onto why I love the game so much: it’s probably a mixture of nostalgia and obsession. I believe that it would be in my top 5 games that I’ve spent the most time on (I’ve probably beaten it 12 times), and it’s quite ultimately the game I am the most familiar with.One of the more-objectively strong reasons why I love Vice City over the other GTA games is that Tommy Vercetti, as a main character, makes the most sense. It’s out of character for the majority of GTA characters to run around on a rampage. Vercetti is a sandpaper-rough, heartless shell of a man: he only wants to get the money back that was stolen from him, and he’ll work with whoever he can to achieve his goals. Some people may see him as a bit of a shallow character, but I’d rather that over a bad-guy-turned-good, like a lot of the other main characters in the GTA series. It just makes no sense for Niko (from GTA IV) to mow down dozens of pedestrians, when a lot of his dialogue is about the horrors of war back in his homeland, and how he is coming to the US to make himself a new life. Plus he first appears wearing a light blue-green Hawaiian shirt i mean what is there not to love.Much like the cast of characters, the story of Vice City worked so wonderfully because the developers threw it all against the backdrop of the nineteen eighties, which was in itself just a rip roaring time to be alive. At least that’s the impression one gets from games and television. You know, if you ignored the cold war, economic recession and the bad hairstyles. Vice City won in my eyes as it was a straight up gangster story. It certainly helped that it was basically a retelling of Scarface. If you’re going to make an 80s gangster movie there’s no better source material.Now onto the most-subjective reason why I love the game, even more so than pure nostalgia: the radio stations, or more specifically: V Rock. I still have the entire audio file of the station on my computer, and I’d listen to it separate from the game. I listen to it while i’m driving around today so that must count for something. V Rock is still for me the pinnacle of in game music. As someone who wasn’t that into music in my younger days, I can thank V Rock for introducing me to the bands I would still be listening to today. 2 Minutes to Midnight by Iron Maiden, Bark at the Moon from Ozzy,♥♥♥♥♥On Feel The Noize by Quiet Riot, Twisted Sister, Motley Crue and many more. Classic metal at its finest. It was also hosted by everyone’s favourite radio host Lazlow, of Chatterbox fame.This isn’t to say that Vice City is a perfect game, but then again I personally believe that a critical part of loving something is realising that it’s not perfect, and being okay with its faults. The game has some pretty obtrusive shooting controls, because of the early lock-on mechanic. It’s the same sort of issue that the other PS2-era GTAs had. This makes the shooting parts of gameplay quite unnecessarily hard. Not that I dislike a hard game, but I want to at least feel as though I am in control when I am getting the crap shot out of my character. To summarise, Vice City is a great combination of atmosphere, story, characters, and soundtrack. If you’re only familiar with the Grand Theft Auto games with fancy graphics on current-gen consoles, then you really should give Vice City a try. You can thank me later.

Posted: December 16, 2014
												One of the best series of games I have ever played in my entire life. The game presents a wonderful story of Tommy Vercetti who framed by his friends goes to jail. Our adventure with main character starts after leaving the prison. The story resembles the movie "Scarface". There are many missions, outside the main thread we can perform many side tasks from playing with the guardian of law who must kills the villains , to the distribution of pizza or "ice cream".The entire map of the game is a great matched and explore it and look for the secrets hidden on the map gives us many hours of unforgettable adventures. Compared to the previous section, in Vice City we have a choice of more cars and boats, as well as motorcycles and helicopters. For carrying out the missions we get money that we can buy new weapons and houses. In this game, there are plenty of weapons to choose from a baseball bat to a minigun.The Radio Station has a lot of amazing music from 80’s. I have discovered many of greatest songs.The system of save game is well considered. In every house, we can save the progress.I went Vice City 5 times. Never get bored. At the end of the main story I have always tears in the eyes.I recommend this game.11/10 from me.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2015
												"Welcome to Vice City, 1986. . . ."IntroductionGrand Theft Auto: Vice City. In a sense this is the game turned the franchise from a cult classic, to a game that everyone wanted. Since while in GTA, and GTA II, it was a top based shooter. There was no real story line, and general it was a cult game series. GTA III, it gave you a silent hero based in 2001. You suddenly were able to shoot in a 3-D environment, and had an actual story line. Well here in Vice City, they've take the formula that worked, and added more to it, so let's do it!Story 10/10The idea is you're Thomas Vercetti, a man who has just done 15 years in jail for "the family", your sent down south to buy some cocaine and get it back north. Well the deal goes south, and now you owe the 'family' a load of money, and you need the cocaine. As you investigate what happened, and you get your revenge. You'll see how Tommy changes in Vice City, from a hired gun, to something more. What I like about this story line, is that it's believable. Based on what I've found of the era (mid-80's), and the character profile we get of Tommy. Since if someone were thrown into his situation, with his connections. What he becomes is plausible, pending him getting arrested or killed. As a note here to the writers, they could've gone with some very immature humour, but when it does go funny, its done with a sense of class almost.Graphics 9/10I know some people are going to be screaming at me over this, since I gave the graphics a 9 rating over a 10. This game is 12 years old, and yes its aged well. I've seen modem games with worse graphics, at a higher price.Each gun, each car, even key people look unique. However, the problem is there are gaps where you see 'blue', and sometimes the details that separate two cars is so small you need to be the developer to see it. The other problem is running though trees, half the time Tommy is hidden from you. Which means you can't see him, and you see a 'blue' outline around the leafs.Sound & Music 11/10This is not a joke people. I am giving this game a 11/10 for music and sound. Since this is audio perfection. One of the reasons why I bought this game was for the in game radio. Besides the fashion, the radio music & chatter help set the mood for the game. You get an idea of what it was like to be in the 1980's. Where the cold war wasn't over yet, or how rap music was brand new. This is where you're going to get the real bang for your gaming dollar. Since I admit it, there are times I just load up the game, slap on a station as I do something else on my PC.Besides the music, you can listen to how a gun fires and you've got a good idea of what's being fired at you. Maybe you can't tell the difference between two Semi-automatics. However, if someone close to you is firing a pistol, and the guy next to him is using a shot gun. You can tell the difference, and when you're outgunned, that kind of information is handy.Game play 8/10I've got a few complains about the actual game engine per say. Sometimes the game lags for a few seconds when swapping radio stations, or exiting a vehicle. Other times, you can't see a 'target' circle on someone you're simpering, and when you pop off the shot it works. Who can forget that when firing from a vehicle, how there is no targeting circle. Its all guess and check. With the exception of when you're being driven by someone else.Now the beautiful part of this engine is how you've got to account for something moving. Most games if you're moving, you aim, you fire, you hit. In This game, you need to account for the motion of yourself, or the target, and sometimes both. The controls that are used are used in almost every game so the learning curve is not a long one.9/10

												Tips:Leave Frame Limiter ONTurn Trails OFFInstall a graphics overhaul modUse your gfx cards software crank up the antialiasingRevisiting games from yesteryear can often leave a sour taste in your mouth, but Vice City is a gem that will continue to please for years to come. My patience for games isnt what it used to be but I'm still having fun working towards 100% completion on this one.

												GTA Vice City takes place in in Vice city, in the year of 1986, and we Play as a mob named Tommy Vercetti, that just after getting out of prison, got in a drug deal for his crime family that goes wrong, and now he owes them lots of money. + Vice city is a great, beautiful city to get lost in, the sun, beaches, bikinis, roller blades, neon lights, everything just screams the 80's.+ Good graphics for the time (looks dated now, but tolerable)+ Great gameplay for the time + Good arcade driving physics+ Different outfits were introduced+ Has Cars, bikes, boats, helicopters and a plane+ Motorbikes, Helicopters and a Plane (1 sea plane ) were introduced and are very fun to use+ Great story, with many references to 80's movies, with a heavy influence from Miami vice and Scarface.+ Tommy Vercetti is badass+ The open world, now considered small, felt very big at the time, with around twice the area of GTA III+ Good selection of weapons+ One of the best soundtracks of the whole series, with MANY awesome 80's hits+ Huge mod community- You can't swim (which feels odd, as the game focuses on a tropical setting)- The game introduced proper flyable planes to the series, but only had one, a seaplane, and i feel this was a missed opportunity to add a normal plane as well. - gets stretched visuals on widescreens (To fix this I recommend the widescreen Patch by ThirteenAG)I also recommend the "silent patch", by silent, that fix many bugs of the gameThis game took everything that made GTA III a great game and improved upon

number of helpful: 14 of 16 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
"Funny how?"Full of pop culture charm, sarcasm and blaring synthesisers, Rockstar's love letter to the likes of Goodfellas, Boogie Nights and Scarface really reflects the mastery of Vice City and the game's success. Voiced by none other than Ray "Henry freakin' Hill" Liotta, your journey as Tommy Vercetti through this '80s odyssey and crazed sea of neon lights, big hair and bright clothing features some of the best content that the GTA series has to offer.One of the reasons Rockstar Games continues to set and then decisively smash the standard for open-world wish fulfilment is because of just how brilliant their games are. Boasting an intellectual depth that far exceeds its critics, the GTA series in particular is yet to be equalled in humour and outright cynicism. I wouldn't be lying when saying that Rockstar continues to deliver some of the most relentlessly funny and cutting wit that's out there. I'll often stop playing to just listen and laugh at the latest crack at modern society. When there's better writing for radio station advertisements than the majority of real life television and cinema, it really shows just how great this series is. That's not to say that gameplay doesn't have something to do with it. The sheer amount of things to do, missions to complete and areas to explore here is astronomical, as is the case for the rest of the series. If you're looking for something to kill time with, then look no further. Old-school GTA has got you covered.Sure, the visuals have certainly aged, featuring blocky character models and low-res textures, but the rest of the game remains timeless. I’d wager that even the most stubborn of graphics diehards would soon become absorbed by the otherwise top-notch quality. With a tonne of varied environments and satisfying gameplay to boot, Vice City is just as good as it's modern counterparts. In the pre-San Andreas and GTA V world, there wasn't that much on offer in terms of the games we take for granted today, with most of the popular and ambitious titles back then confined mainly to the fantasy/role-playing market or the occasional narrative-driven FPS. Like the early days of cinema, crime was seen as taboo and highly controversial but - thankfully - titles such as GTA and Manhunt were set to change that, regardless of the backlash. A significant departure from the rather empty feel of GTA III, Vice City delivers yet again on what you'd expect from the series. The few noticeable flaws were mainly down to clipping or the occasional bug or glitch but nothing major. It's held up really well and remains popular for a reason. Whether stealing a tank from the military or attacking a fortress with a helicopter-mounted machinegun; from trying to hold out against the cops to being caught in a (relatively) high speed chase after a buggy while riding a bike with a blown-out tyre, this has it all. Better still? Grandmaster Flash and the Furious Five’s ‘The Message’ was blasting all the while over the radio.Good times. All that and more awaits in Vice City.

												5/5 Most of my playtime with GTA Vice City has been with the physical disc version (DVD ROM) and PS2 version. So my Steam stats don't reflect all of my experience with this game.PROS:+One of the funnest open-world/sandbox games ever made.+HUGE and diverse environment to explore!+Fully interactive environment.+Great variety in missions, both story based and side jobs.+Diverse choices of vehicles, weapons, and character skins.+Great story. On par with Martin Scorsese films, with a good dose of pop culture satire.+Awesome soundtrack, reflecting the 1980s setting of the story.+Memorable characters with excellent voice acting.+Modest hardware requirements: any PC built after 2002 or Mac built after 2008 should be able to run GTA Vice City.+Gamepad support, both Direct Input (Logitech/PS3/generic) and Xinput (360).+Windows and Mac versions included.CONS:-6th gen (PS2 era) graphics will put off graphics snobs.-No multiplayer.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is loosely modeled after Miami, Florida. You play as Tommy Vercetti, a Mafia hitman released from prison who returns to Vice City and builds a criminal empire. The soundtrack fit perfectly for the era the game was set in and was just a great mix of music. While the graphics are considered outdated by today's standards, Vice City was and remains one of my favorites in the series for the nostalgia factor. Originally released in 2002 on the PS2, and later in 2003 for Windows, it was considered to be the best selling video game of all time on the PS2. Grand Theft Auto: Vice City was my very first introduction into the GTA Series. Back in 2004 or 2005, I had just gotten the new PS3 with the emotion chip, so I was able to play most playstation 2 games. There was a lot of controversy around Vice City at the time for the graphic violence and hidden sex scenes and everyone was anticipating the release of San Andreas, so I picked it up to see what the fuss was about. I must have played this game for days on end, it was such a blast. If you love the GTA Series, this is worth playing through at least once.

												I rarely wrote reviews to games. Because I can't really give out points that nobody said already.But I'm going to do it anyway.First off this game is brilliant. The atmosphere perfectly captures the 80's. It's like I'm in a 80's film. Yes Atmosphere is really what made this game great. Yes. However that's not the only thing that's great. It also has great soundtracks and fun mini games. What more could you ask for?Plus this is the first game I have ever played in my life. It made me into gamer. However this game does have flaws. The main one for me is that the game only runs when it feels like it. I had a tough time trying to make it work. And finally the flying controls are crooked beyond all belief but not as worse as San Andreas. (That's a story for another day)In conclusion this game is great. I recommend it. Buy it.

He even went to the army, to obtain government protection, knowledge and money, which always lacked. But even this did not help him to avoid bad influence: doing another "civil" job of his commander, he violated the Charter and in a moment was outside the gate of military garrison.The prospect of washing the nights dishes in the restaurants did not suit him, so the route remained single — hires apprentices to local gangsters. But how can you take seriously these clowns? The first lives in the port hangar and drunken, and the second rat and a misogynist, and a third for hours talking about their genitals. The last straw was returned from prison lance caught shaped jerk: he immediately began does business behind Vick and communicate with corrupt police. Long endure such an environment was impossible — I had to take the command in his hands.In the brothel — in a helicopterVice city eighty-fourth is a reduced copy of Moscow of the early nineties, when the "white" business did not exist in principle, but the negotiations much to decide the fists and "trunks". Therefore, to build their own criminal Empire have literally brick by brick. Victor goes to the neighboring areas, captures the building and makes them his property, after having disposed of the former owners.After several hours of heavy activity, he becomes owner of several brothels and gangster dens and pairs of points on the sale of drugs, bringing considerable income. The process is no less amazing than the result — I feel like a young entrepreneur who works like a bee from morning till evening. And no matter what it does not built kindergartens and hospitals — market laws are the same for all undertakings.No, crazy action when porting from one platform to another turned into an economic simulator. Just in Rockstar's once dared to change some well-established principles, and the most striking example — a system of unarmed combat. If earlier the clothes that were only stupid to thrash arms and legs, Vic is able to conduct suffocating grappling and lock techniques of the opponent (due to military training?). Traditionally, when the desire on fighting and shooting may be time to close my eyes and instead, steal a fancy convertible, going to the waterfront to admire the red-orange sunsets, ride a jet ski on the water channel or to look at the city from the helicopter.So good games under the brand name Grand Theft Auto that are not forced to adhere to a strictly defined lines of conduct. Vice City stories respects tradition and relies heavily on the attention of the public familiar with the series. Terse and business Victor fits perfectly into the role of the godfather of the city, continuing the tradition of predecessors: he can work before losing momentum and in a big way to relax. Sorry, will shoot him in the Prime of life at the peak of fame. But the writers released him two years he will hold in his pleasure.The programmers at Rockstar Leeds to make the most of outdated engine everything: the picture quality here is even higher than in the original Vice City for the PlayStation 2. Even the wheels of the machines of steel volume, explosions are more colorful, and the animation movements are smooth and natural. Local radio stations for any musical taste and still pleased with the work of competent DJs. The rest of Vice city is mostly quiet and calm, as befits the relaxed southern city. Only the sound of gunfire and sirens occasionally break this idyll. The next "Stories" turned out to be perfectly optimized for the features of the platform: helicopters obediently "float" in response to the command, shooting at enemies easier mode avtopritselivaniya, and to steer the car even just at high speed. If here and there an accident, mostly the fault of other road users. Some missions seem impenetrable and can only be after a dozen fruitless attempts, however, after mastering all the intricacies of the task management clicking like nuts. However, neither one of them is not like another — and have the crowd of bandits to the ground to lay, and seniors home to deliver. A true Paradise for the budding gangster. This is not a standalone project, and another story on the life of gangsters that fit into the events of the series. Not just a game but a real world in which you want to return again and again.

content:
Posted: January 30
												"And I ran, I ran so far away. I just ran, I ran all night and day. I couldn't get away." Vice City has it's charm in being set in the 80's. Everything you would expect from that timeline has managed to find it's way here: neon lights, hawaiian shirts, synthwave, everyone being doped up, etc. It looks great aesthetically. Riding a motorcycle and listening to 80's tunes with palm trees in the background is always enjoyable, including the 80's filter that was originally on the ps2 that helps give it a more authentic experience (it can be downloaded on pc with mods). However, after playing this for so long this title feels lacking especially when compared to the other entries. The map is very small and you can drive around Malibu in around 2 minutes. There aren't much attractions other than a dance club and the beach. The characters aren't that interesting and more-so try to fit the 80's stereotypes. Most missions are dull, they include tasks like checkpoints, driving around an 80's rock & roll band or killing someone at a golf course. It makes the character feel like a chauffeur, and the missions tend to have more style than substance. Also, the plot takes the character from faction to faction without trying to bring together a world with interrelated characters and stories, concluding to a rushed ending that comes together sloppily. It's still fun due to nostalgia and if the neon lights aren't a deterrence than Vice City should be enjoyable.

content:
Posted: May 19, 2016
												My favorite game in the franchise. Instead of silent protagonist Claude, you are now playing as Tommy Vercetti, charismatic member of Italian Mafia, who gets out of prison after serving 15 years for multiple killings. Soon enough he gets involved in a drug deal gone wrong and determines to find out who was behind it while building his own criminal empire.Setting is moved from cold streets of Liberty City to more relaxed Vice City which is based on Miami. References to 80's culture are numerous - disco music, pastel suits, styled cars. The American crack epidemic, drug trafficking and organized crime that followed it are heavily represented in the game, which also draws inspiration from many movies and tv series such as Miami Vice, Scarface, Carlito's Way, Godfather and many others. I will mention some examples:Retired colonel from Central America and drug trafficker Juan Cortez - parody of Manuel Noriega, Panama dictator and major player in drug trafficking during 80's.Drug baron Ricardo Diaz may be influenced by Frank Lopez, character from Scarface who happens to be played by late Robert Loggia who did voice acting for Ray Machowski, corrupt police officer in GTA 3. Diaz's mansion is very similar to Montana's from the same movie. Betrayal and the same clothes also add to the full picture. Interesting thing is that he is voiced by Luis Guzmán who played Gonzalo Rodríguez Gacha, drug trafficker and one of the leaders of the notorious Medellín Cartel in Netflix original series Narcos. Diaz's physical resemblance and temper to him are rather substantial.Ken Rosenberg's appearance and behaviour are nearly identical to David Kleinfeld, who was played by Sean Penn in Carlito's Way.Lance Vance is voiced by Philip Michael Thomas who played Ricardo Tubbs in Miami Vice, which heavily influenced Vice City.Tommy Vercetti was inspired by Tony Montana from Scarface. Memorable shootout scene was also incorporated.Last but not least there is Escobar International Airport, no need to say anything about that one.Game introduces bikes which are way more fun to drive than standard cars and will probably become your first choice in exploring the city. Later you get access to helicopters which are easy to control and are much better solution when you need a quick way to certain place, or you just want better view of the city. Those who prefer adventures on the sea are not forgotten, you can also drive boats.Major gangs in VC are Cubans, Haitians, Vice City Bikers and members of Forelli Crime Family. All of side activites from GTA 3 are also present here. Newly introduced are assets purchases. They include strip club, taxi company, film studio, dance club, printing works, car showroom, ice cream factory and boatyard. Each of them has a number of missions attached, and once all of them are complete a given property will begin generating an ongoing income.There is nine radio stations in the game - on seven of them you will listen great collection of licensed music, while talk shows that contain lots of satire are on remaining two. Big step was made compared to previous title in quantity of material - there is over 10 hours of it compared to 3.5h in GTA 3.Voice actors lineup and their performance is phenomenal; Ray Liotta, Tom Sizemore, Burt Reynolds, William Fichtner, Dennis Hopper and Danny Trejo are present among many others. One person that you certainly don't expect is porn actress Jenna Jameson, who gives voice to appropriately named character Candy Suxxx.Like its predecessor, Vice City was given a lot of GOTY awards and achieved huge commercial success, over 20 million sold copies speaks for itself. I really liked main character, and hope that Rockstar will bring him and Vice City setting back in the future.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												GTA Vice City, a game created by Rockstar North (Edinburgh, Scotland), which was released a year after the release of GTA III, on October 2002 for the PS2, and later ported to PC in May 2003.StoryThis time around, the game was based in Vice City, which resembles Miami.You are playing as Tony, a member of the Forelli Family, which is based in Liberty City. The Don decided to expand its borders, so they give you huge ton of money and send you to Vice City to make a deal. Unfortunately, you get ambushed. All the money is lost and now you have to find a way to pay them back.GTA Vice City solved all the issues that the 3rd one had. They doubled the amount of vehicles[gta.wikia.com], songs in radio stations and weapons. They even added flyable helicopters and a plane to the game.The solved the issues with gangs being hostile towards you. For those that don't remember, 5 out of 7 gangs would be hostile towards you by the end of the game in GTA 3. It became really annoying considering that some gangs had shotguns which could blow up your car in 2 shots. Well, in Vice City, there would be only 1 gang that would be hostile to you.The plot itself is also very enjoyable, unlike GTA 3. It has a very cool feel to it, as if i am in some Al Pacino movie. Just watch a few minutes of it and you may understand why.


YouTube™ Video: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City - Cinematic Movie HD 

			Views: 285,583		

			UPDATED VERSIONS BELOW! Grand Theft Auto: Vice City - PS4 Emulation = https://youtu.be/fCXsjBSSgcA Grand Theft Auto: Vice City - 10 Year Anniversary = https://youtu.be/lRmyVTcBJQg Grand Theft Auto...		

Comparison to its predecessor - GTA IIIThey added more game mechanics. You could damage cars with melee weapons, shoot the tires (the cops would even have spiked strips during chases), and now you are able to shoot through windows of a car, giving you the ability to kill the driver.They added the ability to wear outfits (some areas, like the police station can only be accessed with such uniforms).They added motorcycles.They added assets and safehouses which can be bought. Assets would have a set of missions that if you complete, you would get profit from. Safehouses would allows you to save your game and store additional cars in the garage. GTA III had only 3 safehouses, which are unlocked as you progress through the story. Well in Vice City, you get 9.They also added a few helicopters, and a plane that was actually flyable this time.The amount of weapons increased, usually each weapon tier would give you a choice of about 3 weapons. But the biggest change was the addition of melee weapons. Unlike GTA III, where you only had a baseball bat, in Vice City you get to play with katanas, chainsaws, screwdrivers, machetes, golf clubs and so on.Unlike GTA 3, Vice City featured a full map that you could view, and icons were visible throughout the whole game.They added the ability to crouch. Most of the time i see some one playing older GTAs, most of them never use that mechanic. Well, let me clear some things out for you. Most objects in GTA, even cars, are made that way, so that when the player crouches, it fully covers him. But when you are starting the firing animation, your character will rise a bit above his cover. So in a way, this is kind of like the Gears of War cover system.Now most people don't understand the importance of this mechanic. If you played GTA III, you probably know that there weren't a lot of shootouts. Most of the game, you are using your cars for your missions. Well, the crouching mechanic changed that, making at least 50% of game involve shootouts.If you really planning on completing every mission in the game, you need to learn to take cover.Do i recommend it?Well, this is probably the only game that is set in the 80's period. The songs in the radio, the cars, the city itself - the game is just so good at capturing the feel of the 80s. This is definitely a gem.As always, the PC port suffers with the same issues as in GTA III. Mouse problems and FPS locked to 30. Most glitches can be fixed with SilentPatch, which i suggest you install before playing.Other than that, this is the 2nd game of the GTA III era, which are all connected. And chronologically, plot wise, they are set in this order:1986 - Vice City1992 - San Andreas2001 - GTA III

Posted: November 23, 2016
												Gonna keep this short and sweet:Plenty of great radio stations (80's pop, VCPR with Maurice Chavez, rock, etc) and the ability to use your own mp3s, as well.Really nice arcade-y vehicle handling and the introduction of motorcycles to the series. Feels great hitting a ramp while popping a wheelie on a PCJ-600 or off-roading on a Sanchez.Voice acting and script is a great cheesefest of humor and 80's mob movie cliches.Plenty of side-stuff to do if you don't feel like furthering the main story.Great game to load up just to ride around for a few minutes listening to the radio, finding secret ramps/packages, and just causing havok in general.Just overall an awesome game that I keep finding myself going back to whenever I get bored or want some mindless entertainment.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2013
												Vice City is my personal favorite of all the GTAs and all 'round my favorite game of all time, and listen to me as I tell you why...  Back when all I had was a teeny-tiny, weak and slimy laptop, I would wait for school to end just so I could go home and visit the beautiful Vice City. During cold winters there would be nothing warmer than loadin' up my game and running 'round the beach, soaring the skies with a "Zimmer" or ruling the streets with a "Cheetah"...  Vice City is a game done right! It doesn't seek to be more than it needs to be, as in: the story is perfect, to simply put it: nothing more - nothing less, the combat isn't as good compared to what games we have nowadays, but at least *I* had a hell of a time blasting ruthless gangsters with an Uzi from the window of my car, setting up bombs in a van and jumping out, as it would rush to the unexpecting law-breakers and go KA-BOOM! or going on a rampage and decapitating four men at a time with a single swing of the sword!  Vice city also lets you get into the whole island-resort thing by giving you access to boats & yachts with which you can feel the king of the island as you ride the waves with great triumph! You can also feel the city's night life as the neon lights fill the streets on evenings and shine bright all night long!  My advice to those who lost all hope of going on a warm vacation, to those who wish to be where the sun shines in the middle of winter: play Vice City, and aaall your dreams will come true!

content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												A sure-fire classic. It has great graphics, great music, fanatical voice talent, an intelligent plot, dynamic gameplay and a universe of models that will be hard to match.Vice City doesn't improve much on the few shortcomings of its predecessor. Fortunately, it doesn't have to.More interiors in Vice City would be welcome, but the city is huge with plenty of unique terrain. It's a little disappointing that jetliners and more planes aren't available, but the thrill of flying the Hunter and going on multiple Vigilante missions makes up for it.Vice City is one of those rare games that effortlessly combines atmosphere, engaging gameplay, and great graphics and sound to make a truly unique gaming experience.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2016
												I loved this game, I must have several hundred hours on it, from playing it back in the day.However, the steam version is a headache and then some. Here’s some of the several troubleshooting issues you’ll have to go through.DirectPlay. Firstly, you’ll have to enable this, the path is Control Panel > Programs and Feature > Turn Windows features on or off > Legacy Components > Direct Play.Next, it’s not compatible with your OS unless your running 98 or XP, if so, you have more issues to worry about. Go to compatibility, select Windows 98, also, reduce the colour mode, along with the bits, alongside applying it to run in 640 x 480 resolution. Think you’re done? Nope. You just applied for a part time job as a computer technician. Next issue, it will ask you to insert the CD. That’s right, the digital copy you purchased, most likely for the main reason of having easy access to a childhood game, will ask you for a CD. So, the main way you’ll be able to resolve this is if you delete the audio folder in your steam apps, and replacing it with the CD versions audio folder, thankfully, I kept my CD for this part, if not, you have to illegally torrent the game, but if you do so, you won’t have the fun of troubleshooting. Don’t worry, it gets better, the game can now load and you can play it, however, the audio will not be compatible with the game itself, so you won’t hear anything. No awesome 80s music or Haitians dying in the streets. The final step, refund this mess that steam provided to you, with no warnings or disclaimers and throw that CD that you kept in perfect condition for the last 14 years at the wall.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8
												After 2001's GTA III, Rockstar Games decided the next venue that we should visit in 2002 was Vice City. And damn! They delivered. GTA: Vice City was an extremely fun game which was built over the strengths of its previous installment but now setting the clock back to the 1980's! This change in the period of time allowed the developers to play more with the satirical comments and dark humour the series is known for. From Scarface to Miami Vice, from the drug trafficking to the strong presence of Cuban and Haitian gangs after the increase of immigration of people to Miami (I mean Vice City) It is all there. True to the series, the freedom is sort of there, but as well as it's 2001 counterpart you have to advance through the story missions to unlock the rest of the map. Either way, the city is beautifully rendered even when the technology which created this map is 14 years old! Nonetheless, the freedom to cause mayhem is there and nothing will stop you to blow some cars and use some cheats to get your weapon kits! Did you pack your swimsuit? Vice City awaits! 9/10Buy it, play it and don't regret it.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												Having trouble with the game? Turn your frame limiter ON! It fixes about 8/10 of the common bugs.Grand Theft Auto: Vice CityVice City is a game from my younger years. I originally bought the game in a special edition set on a CD-disk. Along with a manual and a map of the Vice City. Though i never really got into the missions as a kid, i now decided to boot Vice City again and play the storyline on stream.I can say that Vice City has it's good and bad moments. Good moments as in the gameplay, the story and that pure feeling. Bad moments as in the sometimes poor performance, the bugs and the glitches.I was really caught into the story and have never inserted a single cheat. I spend more than 20+ hours on the game and managed to complete the game with all assets completed(which are side-missions) and had found 90/100 hidden packages. The hidden packages are rewarding and so are the missions. As you play you slowly become more powerful by the mission, yet you do quite some errands but fair is fair, most missions are uniqie, fun and challenging. Even though there is no difficulty,  I managed to struggle with the game for quite some times.The most annoying thing i experienced was the fact that people and vehicles literally vanish or appear out of thin air if you turn around. Scary it was not, annoying it was. Park your car, walk into an alley... come back and 'poof' your car is gone.Yet Rockstar is Rockstar and Rockstar wouldn't be Rockstar if they weren't adding easter eggs and those little secrets, mysteries and theories which just make me melt. During my game i have found quite some easter eggs. Not gonna share or spoil but trust me when i say that they are worth a chuckle and smile.I have played the game without cheats or spoilers and managed to get and take the most out of the game.I can happily recommend the game. It's one of the 'better' Grand Theft Auto games out there and is with that said quite a jewel. Just make sure you have your frame limiter turned on. It literally affects everything. Handling, the speed of vehicles (especially ships ) and much more.Oh and the music is gold. It will help you get that feeling i mentioned earlier!

content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												GTA: Vice City is a tremendous addition to the GTA series.Find yourself in a city full of riches, women in bikinis and fast cars!! This gangsta's paradise is the second 3rd person sandbox open world game of the franchise and it has lots of improvements to offer after GTA3 was out.Your main character is now voiced offering a great set of cinematic cutscenes on every mission that set a completelly new beginning on the sandbox mafia genre games.The humor levels are even more ridiculous now. From the characters down to the radio commercials. There are graphical and animation improvements (windows can brake, nicer explosions, better damage animations) and game play changes (you can now drive motorbokes, boats and planes and copters!). There's a better weapon variety and missions now start to include expanding mechanisms and better side quests!There's also more sexiness around, everywhere. More violence, more abd funnier vulgar language, more vehicle, more of everything.Only one con: you still can't swim :PRecommended? HELL YEAH IT IS. This is an addition a GTA collection should never be missing!No matter how old it is, if you haven't, play this game now!

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8
												Miami Vice... uhh... I mean Vice City is a great game. I've always been a fan of the first generation of GTA's, but Vice City is by far my most favorite GTA. I've played this over and over again back in 2003 and now in 2017 it's still fun to play. The location, the colorful buildings and cars make it a great game to just cruise in your car and enjoy the view.I love that it's taking place in the 80s. It's like walking into the Miami Vice set, but now you can control the main character (Tommy Vercetti), who's voiced by Ray Liotta. Tubbs (Philip Michael Thomas) is the voice of Lance Vance, and the list goes on with famous actors like Burt Reynolds, William Fichtner, Luis Guzmán, and many more! I don't think GTA ever had a greater voice actor cast and I don't think they ever will again.The gameplay is also very good, with enough action, missions, and mini games, but you can also just cruise through the city and do whatever you want. Anyways, if you like the 80s and/or Miami Vice this is a must-have game to play!

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
												Tommy Vercetti, a loyal former member of the Forelli Family, has just been released in 1986, serving 15 years for killing 11 men in the Harwood District of Liberty City in early 1971, earning him the nickname The Harwood Butcher.[3] Tommy's old boss, Sonny Forelli, fears that Tommy's presence in Liberty City will heighten tensions between the other Liberty City families and bring unwanted attention to his organisation's criminal activities.[4]To prevent this from happening, Sonny ostensibly promotes Tommy to a capo and sends him to Vice City under the guardianship of a crooked lawyer and Sonny's contact Ken Rosenberg to act as their buyer for a series of cocaine deals for Sonny, whose interest is to expand his family activities down the South and to overrun the Liberty drug market with the high-end cocaine from Vice City, hoping to create a monopoly on the Liberty City drug ring to establish the Forelli Crime Family on the top.[5]Soon, Tommy and his bodyguards are awaited at the Escobar International Airport by Ken, who gives them an info about the deal and takes them to the docks, where they are awaited by the Vance Crime Family, prominent drug kingpins of Vice City led by Victor Vance, who arrive in the chopper with Diaz. As they settle the deal, they are ambushed by several armed and masked men, who kill Victor and Tommy's bodyguards. Tommy narrowly escapes with Ken from the docks, and as a result, he ultimately loses both Forelli's money and the cocaine in the process. Ken drives to his office, while Tommy returns to his hotel.[6]When Tommy informs Sonny of the ambush, Sonny loses his temper and threatens Tommy with the consequences of attempting to cheat the Mafia. Tommy promises to retrieve the money and the cocaine and kill whoever was responsible for the ambush.[7] Towards this end, Tommy meets up again with Ken at his office, who leads Tommy to retired Colonel and mid-level drug dealer named Juan Garcia Cortez, who was Victor Vance's contact and who organised the deal between the Vances and the Forellis. Cortez expresses regret about Tommy's bad deal and promises that his own lines of inquiry are being made to find out who masterminded the ambush plot. Tommy also meets Cortez's daughter Mercedes, who becomes Tommy's confidante shortly thereafter.While Tommy waits for the outcome of Cortez's investigation, he meets cocky 21-year old British record producer Kent Paul, real estate mogul Avery Carrington, and a mysterious man, who introduces himself as Lance Vance, younger brother of Victor and the underboss of the now-defunct Vance Crime Family, who wants revenge for the death of his brother and also wants the Vance Crime Family back on the map.[8]As time passes, Tommy befriends Cortez and begins to do regular work for him as an errand boy and hitman. On one such job, Tommy is called in with Lance to protect the deal of a drug baron named Ricardo Diaz during a deal with the Cubans, looking to buy some high-end cocaine. During the deal, Diaz is ambushed by a gang of Haitians, but Tommy is able to kill them and save the deal, as well as Diaz's life. Consequently, Diaz begins hiring Tommy for his own agenda. Tommy takes this work because it pays well, in spite of his distaste for Diaz. On another errand for Cortez, he plans to meet a French courier to retrieve missile chips stolen from the French government. The deal is ambushed by several French agents and Tommy later kills the courier, who fled the ambush with the chips, retrieving the items.Tommy learns from Cortez that Cortez's own lieutenant, Gonzalez, was partially responsible for the ambush on Tommy's cocaine deal since he is the only person besides Cortez to know about the deal, and Cortez asks Tommy to kill Gonzalez as a favour, since he was a man who he did distrust and was working behind his back. Afterwards, Cortez voices his suspicion that Diaz might have been behind the ambush. Tommy initially continues the status quo to prepare for his attack, but his hand is forced when Lance attempts to take revenge by himself and fails, forcing Tommy to rush across the city and rescue him from the junkyard in which he is held. With the die cast, the two move quickly to raid Diaz's mansion and execute Diaz. With Diaz dead, and Colonel Cortez fleeing the country to escape the French, the established drug empires in Vice City quickly crumble and Tommy and Lance personally take over, becoming Vice City's drug kingpins.Tommy becomes the head of his own organisation, the Vercetti Crime Family, distancing himself from the Forelli Family and Liberty City and more interested in personally controlling Vice City than being Forelli's puppet. But the more powerful and rich Tommy gets, the more Lance begins to exhibit paranoia and sociopathic behaviours, to the point that he begins to abuse his own bodyguards and constantly calls Tommy in states of hysteria, losing his mind over being just a powerless second-in-command as he was under his brother for the past 2 years. Tommy begins to suspect that Lance is up to something.Tommy makes alliance with Umberto Robina's Cubans against Auntie Poulet's Haitians, even though he is at the same time hypnotised by Poulet's voodoo into helping the Haitians as well. However, Tommy and Poulet part ways Tommy and the Cubans sneak explosives into the Haitian drug factory disguised in Haitian gang cars and blow it up, effectively ending the conflict and putting the Haitians out of business, enabling the Cubans to take over Little Havana. Umberto then becomes Tommy's partner. He also becomes friends with Big Mitch Baker, a leader of the biker gang and a Vietnam veteran, with both the bikers and the Cubans becoming protectors of Vercetti family business.As his drug business expands, Tommy buys assets in nearly bankrupt companies such as a car lot named Sunshine Autos, a cab depot Kaufmann Cabs, a popular night club called The Malibu, a local boathouse, a print shop, Print Works, an ice-cream company, and an adult film company, all of which he turns back into competitive businesses. He also becomes a personal bodyguard to glam metal band Love Fist, and pulls a major bank heist. He starts to control almost all the assets and ties of Vice City: Sunshine Autos as a chop shop, Kaufmann Cabs for money laundering, The Malibu Club for dispatching drugs, the ice-cream company for the production of drugs and the film company to control the underground movie scene.Eventually, the Forelli family discovers that Tommy has gained control over entire Vice City and without having sent a single dime back to them. Sonny is enraged that Tommy has become independent and is hustling him, and sends collectors consisting of high-ranking Forelli members to force money out of Tommy's assets. Tommy disposes of them, but after they injure the elderly operator of his print shop of counterfeit money, he decides to cut Sonny and the Forelli family out of his business, severing his ties with the Forelli family.An angered Sonny arrives in Vice City with a small army of mafiosi, intent on taking their tribute by force. Sonny and his henchmen soon arrive at the Vercetti Estate. Just as Tommy attempts to give them their tribute in counterfeit money, Sonny reveals he is the one who set Tommy up fifteen years before, sending him to kill the eleven men who were expecting him since he was feeling that Tommy would himself take over Sonny's business. Lance then exposes himself as a traitor, revealing Tommy's attempt to fool Sonny, and also admitting to informing Sonny about Tommy's activities in Vice City. Lance explains that he did it because Tommy started to disown him and didn't treat him equally, and wanted him dead so he could rebuild the Vance Crime Family and the fortune he had with his brother. An enraged Tommy starts a gunfight.In the ensuing battle, Tommy first chases, ridicules, and finally kills Lance, then storms downstairs, where he faces off with Sonny,

content:
Posted: August 27, 2015
												Tommy Vercetti, a loyal former member of the Forelli Family, has just been released in 1986, serving 15 years for killing 11 men in the Harwood District of Liberty City in early 1971, earning him the nickname The Harwood Butcher.[3] Tommy's old boss, Sonny Forelli, fears that Tommy's presence in Liberty City will heighten tensions between the other Liberty City families and bring unwanted attention to his organisation's criminal activities.[4]To prevent this from happening, Sonny ostensibly promotes Tommy to a capo and sends him to Vice City under the guardianship of a crooked lawyer and Sonny's contact Ken Rosenberg to act as their buyer for a series of cocaine deals for Sonny, whose interest is to expand his family activities down the South and to overrun the Liberty drug market with the high-end cocaine from Vice City, hoping to create a monopoly on the Liberty City drug ring to establish the Forelli Crime Family on the top.[5]Soon, Tommy and his bodyguards are awaited at the Escobar International Airport by Ken, who gives them an info about the deal and takes them to the docks, where they are awaited by the Vance Crime Family, prominent drug kingpins of Vice City led by Victor Vance, who arrive in the chopper with Diaz. As they settle the deal, they are ambushed by several armed and masked men, who kill Victor and Tommy's bodyguards. Tommy narrowly escapes with Ken from the docks, and as a result, he ultimately loses both Forelli's money and the cocaine in the process. Ken drives to his office, while Tommy returns to his hotel.[6]When Tommy informs Sonny of the ambush, Sonny loses his temper and threatens Tommy with the consequences of attempting to cheat the Mafia. Tommy promises to retrieve the money and the cocaine and kill whoever was responsible for the ambush.[7] Towards this end, Tommy meets up again with Ken at his office, who leads Tommy to retired Colonel and mid-level drug dealer named Juan Garcia Cortez, who was Victor Vance's contact and who organised the deal between the Vances and the Forellis. Cortez expresses regret about Tommy's bad deal and promises that his own lines of inquiry are being made to find out who masterminded the ambush plot. Tommy also meets Cortez's daughter Mercedes, who becomes Tommy's confidante shortly thereafter.While Tommy waits for the outcome of Cortez's investigation, he meets cocky 21-year old British record producer Kent Paul, real estate mogul Avery Carrington, and a mysterious man, who introduces himself as Lance Vance, younger brother of Victor and the underboss of the now-defunct Vance Crime Family, who wants revenge for the death of his brother and also wants the Vance Crime Family back on the map.[8]As time passes, Tommy befriends Cortez and begins to do regular work for him as an errand boy and hitman. On one such job, Tommy is called in with Lance to protect the deal of a drug baron named Ricardo Diaz during a deal with the Cubans, looking to buy some high-end cocaine. content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
												This is a much better game than GTA 3. The design of the missions remains of the "try again" false-difficulty type, however. This means many missions are impossible to complete the first time around, as you have to know what to expect beforehand. This completely ruined GTA 3 for me, but this game is much more enjoyable for some reason. Perhaps it is the fat that I have found a way around the 30 fps cap, running at a smooth 60. The missions seem better thought out, the action improved, especially shooting. However, the long and unskippable cutscenes at the beginning of each mission end up grinding on my nerves after a while, given that most missions need to be undertaken a number of times before succeeding. Overall a very good game, one that I have trouble stopping playing, even today in 2015.  Proof is, I have finished all missions, but still find it fun to do things in the world of Vice City.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
												Vice City has since I played it for the first time on Playstation 2, been my favorite Grand Theft Auto Game.Vice City takes place in the 80s, where you are playing as Tommy Vercetti. Tommy Vercetti has lost a lot of money, and needs to get them back. He is starting to work for people in Vice City, so he can pay Sonny Forelli back.One of the things I was most happy for in Vice City was the music. So if you like the 80 and 90s music, you will like most of the music in Vice City.The PC version includes a lot of new features, here are some of them: Custom Resolutions 	 (Choose your own Resolution) Better Graphics 	 (There is better Graphics and also custom Draw Distance) Custom Radio Station 	 (Upload your own mp3 and make your own Radio Station) Frame Limiter 	 (By disabling Frame Limiter, you can play Vice City in 60fps)There is of course a lot of other new features, this is just some of them.Vice City is of course recommended, and is a game you must play!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												This is one of the, if not the, best games in the series. It's my first GTA game and it's damn awesome. It sets a perfect mood of the 80's with the music, the cars, and other things. The map is decent in size and I still seem to find something fun to do everytime I put the game on. The story is OK, but most people only play this game to mess around in the sandbox (like me). You can buy properties after you finish the career, and some of them can generate money. There's a pretty good variety of vehicles, and the taxis, firetrucks, ambulances, and police cars all have their own missions, as well as a few of the other properties you buy (like the Ice Cream shop). There are also cool minigames scattered around the map, like racing an R/C car in  the sand. I wish that there would be more planes for you to use, since the only one you get is at the top of the endgame mansion. Overall, it's a real fun game, and I give it a 9.7/10.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												I had this game when I was 15 on PS2, almost completed it but due to my file on the memory card being corrupted. I couldn't complete it.So I found GTA VC on GMG for £1.20 and the 15 yo self demanded it to be played and completed. It was hard to not look at it from a 2014 perspective, because I was playing sleeping dogs at the same which is far superior in every way.First of all, use cheats, otherwise you will run out of money buying armour and weapons all the time. Also, as it is an old game, there is no load option in the pause menu. You have to drive to your home to save or load a game, which can get frustrating every time you die or get arrested and want to save money by not spending it again on weapons and armour. The graphics are average, it is an old game so we will let that pass. The physics, however, are absolutely horrible, you fall immediately off a motorcycle from the slightest of touches; using planes and helicopters are a drag, and some cars are just impossible to drive with.OK, the game. Tommy Vercetti is your lead character, and he's come to Vice City to take it over. You do missions for various gangs, businesses, and mafia type bosses. One tip, after a while you'll notice you don't have any missions to do, even though the story is clearly not finish. You have to buy the printworks, and 5 other businesses (Not Homes!) and complete the missions for all of them. To know if you completed the missions, the businesses will generate money for you which you can collect often. DO NOT BUY THE PORN STUDIOS! The missions for that one are absolutely dire and no fun at all. Best ones are the Kauffman cab, and I heard the Malibu club is pretty good too.After a while you're old mafia boss comes after you and you have to kill. It's pretty basic mafia story that is clearly inspired by scarface. It's a good story and you do enjoy watching the cut scenes due to the array characters involved.GTA VC is still for me the best GTA game. The size of the  map was perfect and the story was pretty decent1The radio shows are also perfect, playing the best music that represents the 80s feel of the game.  Small things like physics of vehicals and graphics are a negative, but they won't be too much of a hassle. I recommend playing with a mouse just so you can shoot better. number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2015
												Vice City is, perhaps, not the most notable game in the GTA franchise. It could've been a DLC for GTA 3, but content-wise it's a full game of its own. It puts you in a world oozing of 80s pop culture, and you would have to be crazy not to love that. The game has some small improvements over GTA 3, and features some new stuff that vary from good to less good. It's easy to see that things started leaning toward a less arcade-like experience than GTA 3, which continued later in the series. For instance, the protagonist now has a voice and personality. The series gains some new grounds with Vice City, but it's pretty much on-par with GTA 3. It's not as revolutionary as GTA 3, but it's definitely a good game, and shows the direction the franchise later took. A positive recommendation from me.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
												The middle child of the GTA PS2 trilogy, and a solid entry in its own right, but for some reason this one just feels a bit more of an afterthought compared to the other two. Objectively, it's better than GTA3 in most ways, but it's not the original, nor does it reach the heights of the third game - this is likely amplified because I came to this game after having played the other two. That being said, this game is an absolute joy to play, and anyone who has nostalgia for the 80s will LOVE the music.So, just like the other two, a must-have for any person looking to build the collection. If you're only picking up one GTA from this era, I would suggest getting San Andreas, but really, everyone should pick up all three.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 4, 2015
Short version: 92%GTA: Vice City is probably the goofiest, yet most timeless entry in the GTA series. Bright colours, fast cars, nonsensical missions, funny characters, and great controls made sure that this game is still regarded by many as their favourite in the franchise.Long version:Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is a strange one, even for GTA. The whole game is more or less an 18-hour parody of Miami Vice– a half-forgotten, enjoyably dumb action show of the 80s. Everything is colourful and neon bright, and practically every story mission, every character, every random dialogue is a parody of something (just listen to the two talk show radios; they are full of the weirdest things).What makes it a masterpiece is that none of these are over the top. The storyline may be silly at some points, but the core of it is deadly serious: you play as a gangster who was sent to Vice City (Miami) to create a foothold for the Mafia drug business. The deal goes belly-up, but by the end of the game you somehow become the de facto crime lord of the city, either by buying or killing any opposition.The missions that lead to this goal have great variety and design; almost none feel the same and everyone can find their favourites among them. To complete them, you have access to a wider variety of weapons and vehicles, which now include aircraft and motorcycles. Travelling around is quite easy and fun now.Many old-school game elements like bomb shops and the top-down camera were removed, but they are rarely missed with such improvements as purchasable assets, which all can be turned into a money-making machine after you complete their associated tasks. Although you still cannot spend that money on anything but more assets and weapons.These smaller and larger touches not only made Vice City a great game, but also probably the most characteristic and memorable one in the GTA franchise, earning it a permanent spot in many of the players’ hearts.

So I know a lot of things about this game.First of all pros:+ Characters were... ummm, good.+ Music was awesome.+ Realistic driving handling.+ Nice atmosphere for its time.+ Acceptable graphics for its time.+ Good side-missions.Cons:- Missions were so unbalanced. You can die in 2 or 3 seconds if you are under enemy attack.- You'll come to a point where you'll need a lot of money. Yes, you'll stuck for having small amount of money...And also, %100 of this game is hard. Yep, this is really hard. This was harder than San Andreas for me.But overall this was a nice and fun experience for me eventhough I rage quit and screamed a lot. I can't believe myself how I missed this masterpiece.

content:
Posted: November 22, 2016
												A true classic. While I would not consider this the best in the series, it is definitely a fun game. GTA Vice City capitalizes on GTA III's mechanics, but adds a whole new story and setting with interesting characters and a fun plot. The game is buggy and annoying at times, and trying to beat the game without using any cheats to earn money is almost impossible, but if you do, it is completely satisfying. In my honest opinion, I recommend completing GTA III first just to make the whole game's experience a bit more familiar and easy. GTA Vice City is a classic and is always fun to revisit every now and then.
