												GTA Vice City is a great game and maybe you've played it before on the PS2 or Xbox. This is less of a review and more of a, "here's what you need to get it running perfectly on PC." Because, by default, it doesn't support widescreen resolutions, you need to force v-sync, it has a number of bugs that can be fixed using a patch,Let's start with the controller. This modder, Silent, is a diety. They've done so much for the classic GTA games. They modded the GInput inputs for 360 controllers so that the 360 controller button will actually appear on screen, not to mention function since Rockstar really didn't bother with controller support for the PC versions. Also, the controllers can be set to the style of GTA IV gameplay. This mod has full support of other controllers as well, such as the Dualshock and most certainly Logitech controllers. I haven't tried the Steam controller on it though. Download it here: http://www.gtagarage.com/mods/show.php?id=24272, you'll be able to pick out Vice City from the options given. Once download, just unzip and follow the instructions.To get GTA Vice City working in widescreen, you will need to download a fix from ThirteenAG. It's extremely simple. Just download, unzip, and read the instructions. https://thirteenag.github.io/wfp#gtavc You'll also see widescreen fixes for GTA III and San Andreas if you haven't gotten to those.To force v-sync, it's going to depend on whether or not you're using an AMD or Nvidia card. I have an AMD R9 280, so if you have an AMD card, you're going to want to access the Radeon settings, go to the gaming tab, find Vice City, click it, find a tab that says "Wait for Vertical Refresh", hit the drop down arrow, you want it set to always on. On an Nvidia card, you want to open the Nvidia control panel, go to 3D settings, find Vice City from the drop down bar, select it, scroll down til you find v-sync, and same thing, set it to always on.The SilentPatch is necessary if you want good lighting and shadowing. http://www.gtagarage.com/mods/show.php?id=25368, you have your options to choose from the classic GTA games, but be sure to also download the DDraw patch from the same set of downloads. It improves the draw distance. Download both files, extract, and read the instructions.That should be about it. I hope you enjoy the game as it is quite a lot of fun. Brilliant soundtrack. Good story. Fun side missions (asset missions). Doesn't take itself too seriously. It's a solid 9.0/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 2
												GTA 3 is great, but GTA Vice City is greater. Vice City takes what GTA 3 established, preserved it, improved it and added to it. Taking place in 1986 Vice City, you play as Italian American mobster Tommy Vercetti. Immediately upon arriving in Vice City, a deal that was supposed to establish him in the city is attacked, forcing him to leave the goods at the site. The rest of the game involves rising up, killing the man responsible for the attack, obtaining a mansion, killing your former boss and ally, and ruling Vice City. Perhaps the best part of Vice City for me is the soundtrack. Containing many songs from artists like Toto, Hall and Oates, Michael Jackson, Laura Branigan and Foreigner, along with two complete talk show stations, Vice City will keep you busy in the audio department. Unlike the soundtrack of GTA 3 which mostly consisted of stereotypical late 90s pop music and typically left me only tuning to Flashback FM with its Scarface soundtrack, Vice City sometimes left me driving around just to listen to the great music or VCPR, its guests and its bitter Hispanic host, Maurice Chavez. If none of that fascinates you, the PC version supports a custom radio station. Just drag your .mp3 files into its folder, and you can drive to your own music. Sadly, due to the vast amount of copyrighted music, rights expire, and songs are lost. This song being Lionel Richie's "Running With the Night", which was present on the PS2 version but absent from the PC version. Compared to GTA 3, there is alot more things to have and to do. Motorcycles, helicopters and alot more boats are the firsts in the vehicle department. Many more weapons, like revolvers, chainsaws, hammers, combat shotguns, submachine guns, assault rifles, sniper rifles and even screwdrivers are some of the new additions. A lot more is also added mechanic wise, like the ability to dive out of cars, crouch and aim properly are some new additions. Vice City itself is quite beautiful, with many neon, art deco buildings and skyscrapers can be found in the city. Most buildings in the game are just low res textures, but the interiors you could enter are beautiful, like the mansion, the hotel room, the dance club and the strip club. Perhaps the biggest change between GTA 3 and Vice City is the addition of a speaking protagonist. Not only does Tommy Vercetti have a lot more personality and charm, he is more likeable. Another addition is the ability to buy safehouses and businesses. In GTA 3, you are given a safehouse on each island but that is about it. In addition to being more convenient, the latter is also fun and necessary. After killing the man who set you up, you can buy up various businesses around Vice City, like a Car Dealership, a Boatyard, a Strip Club, a Pornography movie studio and a dance club. All of these businesses set up fun missions with them. For example, the dance club opens up a series of bank heist missions, the boatyard opens up a long stunt course, and the car dealership opens up a mission to retrieve certain cars on a list, which will get you both a monetary reward and a bunch of fast cars, like a DeLorean or a race car. There is alot more in Vice City that just have to be seen to be believed. Some features of the PC version include the ability to aim with any weapon, the ability to change the player's skin and, as I mentioned, the ability to make a custom radio station. For the money, Vice City is definitely worth it. Buy it.

Posted: June 30, 2014
												This is one of my favourite games of all time. I have played many of 100s of hours since it's launch on PS2 back in 2002, I own it on pretty much all platforms now.The cheesy 80s, Scarface setting is what most attracts me about this game, I love the era even if I myself was not born in it. It's vivid colours and bright neon lights makes it very colourful, especially if you start painting you car with the blood of an unsuspecting pedestrian. This is a gory game, but it is comical. The story is great and the gameplay is a hell of a lot of fun. Graphics are top of the range but why does it have to be? The many collectables and side missions just keep you playing. Even when you've completed everything you still find yourself running around cauing chaos wherever you can. This is addictive.If you don't already own this game, WHY THE HELL NOT, TOMMY?

content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												It's year 1986 and you playing as Tommy Vercetti, mobster and ex con who manages to screw up a drug deal in mostly sunny Vice City. Now it's up to you, how you will regain money and drugs that you lost. And most of all - do you have enough guts to become crime boss of Vice City? You can wander around in streets of the city, cause mayhem, steal cars, kill everybody you like with nice bunch of different weapons (including chainsaws and katanas), drive taxi or fire truck or deliver pizzas and meet new and mostly corrupt people. Atmosphere is cool as it was in "Miami Vice" and soundtrack is absolutely best in whole game series. More 1980's than decade was itself. Definitely a game you must have.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2011
												[9/10] - I closely relate this game to Mafia II, only because of its ability to really make you feel like your in the times, in this case the 80's. For me, no other two games do it better. This was actually the first GTA title I ever played back in the day, and to this day is still my favorite. No description needs to be made about gameplay, it's fantastic and entertaining just like every other GTA on the market. But for those who have good taste in music, and want to take a ride in the classics, and really just want to feel like you're in one of the best decades ever, then this is where it's at. Not much else can be said except it's great fun, has a good story, and is completely addictive. PS2 is better in my opinion just for the controls, however the PC version looks much better.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												While it may be a far cry from San Andreas or Modern GTA games in terms of content, I'd say this one is my personal favorite for its atmosphere, characters, setting, soundtrack, easter eggs, and nostalgic value. With 1980's charm pouring out of its♥♥♥♥♥ it makes of a unique entry in the series, being riddled with several nods and references to events, and Movies/TV shows (notably Miami Vice and Scarface). The gameplay is your run-in-the-mill post-GTA III formula a.k.a a free-roam sandbox. You go on missions to kill people while protecting and optionally developing your own dirty business that will eventually pay for itself to eventually achieve vengeance. While the story is linear, being a sandbox game, you have plenty of freedom. In addition, you have several sidequests, such as Vigilante and Ambulance mission, or item collecting, with worthwhile rewards, like increased Max Health or Missile-Firing Choppers. The game supports both Keyboard+Mouse and Gamepad modes, which puts this game ahead of its time in this particular aspect.The cons are fairly simple fixes. Being a pre-HD era game, the game isn't optimized for Widescreen monitors, and while there is an in-game option for Widescreen, it steches the HUD and just crops the top and bottom. This can be fixed either by playing it in 4:3, or via simple mods for true, uncropped/unstretched Widescreen. Another issue that may affect most modern rigs is that you may have trouble getting the game to run. This again can be fixed through simple tweaks.If you're gonna get into the GTA games and don't mind playing something that's only a decade old, this entry is definitely one that shouldn't be overlooked.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												GTA Vice City - A true, timeless masterpiece, that has endured the test of time and is still one of the best games in the series.Just like all older games, this one does not strike you with stunning visuals, like the newer additions in the series like GTA IV and V. But graphics is not all about a game. GTA Vice City offers a great story, characters and the feeling of freedom in its beautiful open-world city, that only few other games manage to capture. The refferences to the pop culture of the 80s are to be found literaly everywhere in Vice City, which accomplishes the atmosphere of the 80s' Miami, which the game aims to recreate in its own unique style.  The style of the people that you see in the streets, the cars, the buildings' architecture and the scenery all help you immerse with the game and makes you feel as if you are watching a movie, rather than playing a game.The soundtrack that Rockstar have compiled is divine, topping even those from the newer entries in the GTA series. All the radio stations in the game are absolutely fantastic with songs from the titans of the 80s' musical scene like Michael Jackson, Ozzy Osbourne, Mr. Mister, Toto, INXS, Laura Brannigan and many others. Even if you don't like this kind of music, the game will make you fall in love with it. But there's more - the radio stations' DJs will make you laugh all the time with their comments on topics that satirize different aspects of the life in the 80s. And the commercials too!The story of the game is also brilliant. As if it is directly taken from a classical gangster movie. Filled with action, twists and many great characters you will be thrilled from the start and until the very end. But even after the completion of all the story missions you will have to spend many more hours if you want to unlock 100% of the game. The game will offer you more than at least 20 hours of sheer fun, but no doubt you will want to come back again and play it over and over again. But if you don't like playing by the rules, you will still be able to find lots of fun things to do. Steal a car, go on a rampage, attain a six-star wamted level and have some fun blowing up police and military vehicles and shooting SWAT teams with tons of great weapons, as they try to stop you.More than 10 years after its initial release GTA Vice City is still the excellent game it used to be. If you have not had the chance to play the game until now, do not hesitate and get it right away.10/10 points for an amazing game!

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												It's the eighties, do a lot of coke and vote for Ronald Reagan.Almost everything about this game is perfect, even on PC. Despite being one of the earlier PC ports of the 3D GTA titles it's relatively easy to control. There's a surprisingly large amount of graphics options for such an old game and especially one to come out in this time period when consoles were king in developers' eyes, so kudos to Rockstar for actually thinking this out.I really think that the 80's are the perfect decade for GTA. The decade of decadence. Crime was getting more common, drugs were getting harder and easier to get, and the media was getting more violent. It was a time of total unhindered immoral activity. It basically screams Grand Theft Auto.The soundtrack is amazing. I'm really into heavy metal and new wave, so I'm very biased when it comes to this kind of thing, but trust me, there's nothing like running over pedestrians in a muscle car while listening to Iron Maiden's "Two Minutes to Midnight" or fleeing from the police in a taco truck while blasting "Video Killed The Radio Star" by The Buggies.There's a wide variety of melee weapons, and while the guns are nice I think the wide variety of weapons such as the chainsaw (straight out of Scarface) and a♥♥♥♥♥♥♥really set the tone for the game.Tommy Vercetti is also a great character. He's beautifully two dimensional and the writers didn't try to ♥♥♥♥♥foot around that. He's a cold blooded Mafia hit man who's been released from prison after killing 11 guys and he's still♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off. He's not an Anti Hero like Niko Bellic who's just trying to get the American Dream, nor is he an Anti Hero like CJ who's trying to protect his neighborhood from drugs and rival gangs. He's just a really bad guy. If you cross him, he will kill you. If you mess up a job he's on, he will kill you. If you don't pay him, you guessed it, he will kill you. It's that simple. His American Dream is making others' lives a nightmare.However, there are two things I don't like about this game though. One is the graphics. The models, especially the character models, are terrible. They haven't aged well, and the game was obviously made in 2002. This is especially noticeble when the various "sexy" female characters are onscreen, because while they are obviously human, they basically look like they had their breasts and hips glued on. The wacky 80's hairstyles have a simaler problem, as do the brightly colorerd clothes that the majority of the main characters (and Tommy himself) wear. They look as if they've been painted or nailed on to some kind of puppet or mannequin. I honestly think that the models in System Shock 2 looked better than this.The second thing is the lack of multiplayer. Add the fact that MultiTheftAuto is terrible and you have a huge problem. I understand that when Vice City came out, the main focus was on the PS2, which at that time still didn't have online multiplayer capabilites, so it is forgivable, but still, it's disappointing.Overall, I think this is the greatest Grand Theft Auto game out there. Yes, even better than San Andreas. It's just totally tubular.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												Grand Theft Auto: Vice CityPositives:+ Perfect storyline, well made. + Amazing reconstruction of the 1980's with authentic music on radio stations, similar cars and clothing to the time period.+ Characters, especially the central one (Tommy Vercetii) are interesting.+ Large array of weapons to choose from, military grade assault rifles, pistols, a plethora of melee weapons, rocket launchers, sniper rifles, the list goes on.+ Open-world game where the only limit is your imagination. Mixed:~ Graphics are OK, the game is over a decade old now but still entirely 3D. Negatives:- Game can be viewed as short, takes around 20 hours to finish.Overall Score: 8.5/10Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is a fantastic tale of the criminal underworld in the 1980's. Hugely entertaining game and well worth the price considering it's quite cheap nowadays.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												My favourite GTA game by far. The combination of an 80s setting,great story(plus the amazing soundtrack)gives this game a never-ending charm. This is the only GTA game where I have just sat in my car and left a song playing. The soundtrack of this game is basically a "greatest hits of the 80s", so you could buy this game just for the soundtrack. Now, lets talk about the gameplay. While the game isn't too different from GTA 3, it has some notable improvements. Helicopters are now available to fly and the dodo from GTA 3 is now a proper plane. Motorcycles are also available. Aside from some new weapons, the gameplay hasn't changed much from GTA 3. The story takes elements from Scarface and Miami Vice to create a solid plot. The story has all the usual stuff you expect from a GTA game like betrayal and the rest.Overall, if you are a fan of the 80s or miami, or just GTA in general, then this game is well worth playing.

content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												Personally, this is my least favourite GTA game. That doesn't mean the game shouldn't be played, though. There are many improvements over the first GTA in 3D (GTA III), but I didn't enjoy this one as much.  If you decide to install the texture mod "Vice Cry" (which, by the way, it's pretty good) beware because it might randomly break your save files. After starting a new playthrough with the mod and playing for a week or so, I couldn't load my save file any more and I gave up trying to fix it. Just save in different slots so you don't lose everything, but otherwise I recommend installing that mod and playing this game. And, as always, the music in this GTA is outstanding (specially FLASH FM!). In fact, the music is so good that you'll reach your destination and won't get outta the car until the song finishes... and if you are not quick enough, you'll be stuck in the car listening to the next song too. Worth playing, even if it's just to see the evolution of the GTA franchise and experience the 80's through its soundtrack.

												First half or something oughtta be one of the best storylines in any gta games period.Put you will rpobably get pms during th bank mission, the riding bike on roofs mission (Only of you are darksydephil, i beat that♥♥♥♥♥♥in one try).Amazing characters, even though alot of them gets too little "screen time" or whatever you call it, i don't give a ♥♥♥♥.Lance Vance is hilarious, the voice acting is perfect, and if you like sleazy eighties ballads, you brobably prefer not to leave a vehicle once you entered it. It's aging kind of badly, but hopefully we will get a remastered version in a few yearsThe biggest downside of this game oughtta be the vehicle function, Pretty much any quick turn with your car will flip you over. But the problem is that it sometimes even flips when you are doing slow turn aswell, its almost worse than the vehicles in gta 3.The flight  mecanics could be hard at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's childs play.My favourite detail of this game is that you can shoot someones head of with and automatic rifle or simply just shot if of with a catana like it was made out och foam. the head can pop off even if you hit thm in the chest,♥♥♥♥♥♥s hilarious, holy ♥♥♥♥.The last parts of the game could be compared with cancer, but it's okay, the rest of the game is like snorting cocaine.The ending was a big fat ♥♥♥♥ing aids infecting shit♥♥♥♥ of a disappointment, my neighburs had to call the law enforcement for noise complaint.Even though game could♥♥♥♥♥♥to o out of ten stars to 5 out of five stars.It's ♥♥♥♥ing unbalanced when i come to think of it.And the cops are so ♥♥♥♥ing random. you're in the middle of a mission in the middle of nowhere, shooting down enemies and suddenly, a cop hits you to the ground and you get busted and lose ALL OF YOUR ♥♥♥♥♥ING WEAPONS.But the game had a stripclub so ill give it five out of five.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
												I remember playing this game before I was a teenager on a borrowed PS2 were the disc was accidentally left in the console, whoops! Well im still sane and normal, mostly....To this day Grand Theft Auto: Vice City remains one of my favourite games in the GTA series and still doesn't feel that old. It tells a great story inspired by the 80's Scarface film, only replacing the much loved Colombian-hating Cuban, Tony Montana with a really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off, former mafioso from Liberty City, Tommy Vercetti.12/13 years later, Vice City continues to deliver an entertaining experience that many of the GTA games both old and new do. It puts you in an 80's world where abnormal hair styles were trendy and where great music was played left right and centre. It offers a fantastic set of characters ranging from cool, witless gangsters to psychotic, drug lords who prefer to shoot their VCRs instead of actually plugging them in. It offers a simple but, fun way to run your own little empire of various buisnesses (later on) and never fails to capture that 80's image. Like it's predecessor this game made history, an I am not talking about the number of copies it sold. For many like myself  vice city was dare I say a childhood memory that I will not forgot for as long as I can still play this game. For me this was my introduction to the GTA series and wow was it a good one. If you are a fan of Grand Theft Auto, but have never played this then I can tell you despite it's age, I don't think you will be dissapointed, unless you are a modern graphics/mechanics fanatic, which in that case then you need to broaden your horizans.Do I recommend this game? Absolutely!

												If you got neves to get over tons of bugs this game contains,then you shoul play it. I mean its not that bad,except Lance dying in couple cutscenes and you fail mission,that bug when you are shooting someone from short distance and bullets pass right through him/her,and driving is not that well (car get rolled over very easy and s**t like that)...On the good side,I like the city it self,graphics are ok (considering time game is made),also a lot of cool characters and places (especially if you seen few theme based movies,you can recognize few of them),Tommy him self is cool guy to play as. Story is ok,you go through it easily,no mission is too hard except that one where you have to race that nerd guy in front of the club,where I recommend using slow motion cheat.So game is ok,I had lot of fun and lost nerves playing it,I have spent over 15 hours playing it,so yea,I recommend this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												My favourite GTA game by far. The combination of an 80s setting,great story(plus the amazing soundtrack)gives this game a never-ending charm. This is the only GTA game where I have just sat in my car and left a song playing. The soundtrack of this game is basically a "greatest hits of the 80s", so you could buy this game just for the soundtrack. Now, lets talk about the gameplay. While the game isn't too different from GTA 3, it has some notable improvements. Helicopters are now available to fly and the dodo from GTA 3 is now a proper plane. Motorcycles are also available. Aside from some new weapons, the gameplay hasn't changed much from GTA 3. The story takes elements from Scarface and Miami Vice to create a solid plot. The story has all the usual stuff you expect from a GTA game like betrayal and the rest.Overall, if you are a fan of the 80s or miami, or just GTA in general, then this game is well worth playing.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												Simply the best GTA ever made! There will be no other like this. Players who value an immersive theme and storyline will overlook the now obsolete graphics of this masterpiece, which at the time were almost twice as good as it's predecessor (GTA III). This is one of my favourite games of all time and I'm not saying this just because the 80's are one of my favourite eras in history. Although I only have ~10h on record as I am writing this review, I have played this game for hundreds of hours long before I purchased it on Steam. Game works perfectly on Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit. All those who have problems should look into the compatibility settings.Highly reccomended classic.9/10 - Cuz you die in water, can you blame me?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2015
												This game is by far the best in the GTA franchise and one of my favourite games of all time. I played it way too much back in the days (over 12 years ago as of this review) and since I now upgraded my computer I thought "why the heck not?" and even today this game still delivers! The soundtrack, "Miami", "Scarface", humour, memorable characters and so on. There is simply an endless amount of things to do in this game. I loved taking over the city and owning businesses, collecting money as well as messing around with all the side missions/collectables that actually gave me some useful bonuses.I played through this game in about 16 hours and loved every second of it. This is a standard that games of today never will reach again. I got the complete experience for less than ten euros while other games offer less than half the entertainment for 50-70€ (let's not forget DLC and season passes). Since the game is on sale at the moment I can warmly recommend it to anyone who is even the tiniest bit interested.Buy this game! You will not regret it! 10/10.Note! If you are playing this game on a high end PC you may encounter various bugs and glitches. 90% of them are hilarious but the annoying ones you can easily fix using google.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
												This is the first GTA game I actually ever played, though it's my second favorite in the series. Second only from the length of gameplay though does it fall behind San Andreas, excluding that it has the best campaign of any GTA I've ever played. I remember when it came out that my desktop could barely run it maxed and now my laptop maxes it out with an Intel HD 3000. I decided to mod it up to modern expectations and after many google searches and overhauls I settled on Vice Cry as a base for expansion. Vice Cry tripled the view distance, replaced the meshes for the cars with the xbox versions (higher detail), applied a wide screen and resolution fix, and many other little things. It doesn't replace the Ginput system with the Xinput system (for 360 and PS3 controllers) but there were many guides to replacing it in the community guides that I found in a few seconds. If you can't get your mods running just use the old no-cd patch, name it gta-vc.exe, and Steam will run it fine allowing CLEO and dependent mods to run. NOTE Vice City modders prefer the 1.0 no-cd exe for compatibility reasons but I chose to use the 1.1 exe, no particular reasons, so either works if you have picky mods or crashing. ♥♥♥♥ cheats, get VC Dream and forget about them.

content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
												I love Vice City very much. It was my first in a long line of Grand Theft Auto games, and I couldn't have picked a better game. It sucks you in immediately with its music, sunsets, cars, music, and cast of celebrity voiced characters. It has just the right size of world to explore, from the beautiful sunsets of Ocean Beach, to the heavy Cuban and Haitian influence of Little Hati and Havana. Most of the missions have a laugh or two in them, even if some don't, you can just ignore it, chill out, and listen to the impeccable music on the radio. If you are wanting to play a Grand Theft Auto game, buy this one first. If you are looking for looking for a new game to play, buy this game. For any other reason at all, do yourself a favor and BUY THIS GAME!

content:
Posted: April 23, 2013
												This game is still great to play, and will never get old for me. I don't really need to say much about it, except it has a kickass soundtrack, great atmosphere, and is really fun to play. I even like this one a little more than San Andreas because of the 80's feel it invokes.A couple of points down for the aiming which is a bit wonky on the PC (which can be fixed using a widescreen mod AFAIK) and the fact that Tommy, for being a badass and all that, can't swim. Just like Claude in GTA III. Other than that if you haven't played this I don't know what you're thinking. Do it. A special note about the whole trouble around this game's soundtrack and those of you thinking songs may be missing: Fear not. I bought the recent version of this game after it came back to Steam, and no songs were removed. It's all there. :)

content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												This is a golden oldy! In my oppinion one of the best GTA games. it's not the biggest, nor the best looking, but the story and setting is by far the best in the GTA series.In this game getting a 100% by looking for collectibles, secret jumps, etc. is not a drag but an opportunity to experience all the little quirks and jokes in the game.If you find this game for about €15,- you should definitely buy it! while some people think it's somewhat pricey for a game this old, the time you spend on it and the amusement you get from it is more than worth it!The downside is that there are a few bugs in the game when playing on windows 7 and higher. These bugs are rarely game breaking and often solvable by (ie. turning on the frame limiter- causes a bit lower FPS but in fairness it bring you to the fps the game was ment to play in)Final comments: A great game, somewhat old but 100% worth of your time if you're a fan of the 1960-70's and open world games.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2011
												Greatest game of the eighties? Bordering on it at least. This game is one of the pearls in an already great series. Freedom to move, plotlines to follow, plenty of hidden tricks and secrets, but none of the stupid, grinding character-changing elements of its successors and imitators. It simply oozes 80s style, Miami Vice meets Scarface and has a party on Carlito's Way. And the radio is so good, I have literally sat in a car with a hooker listening to Chavez on VCPR. Does gaming get any better than that?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												The 'Best' GTA game. It is the best GTA due to it's design. The concept is simple. Open world and there are missions. The missions introduce you to new features in the game, or you can explore and find them yourself. San Andreas has the same design but the expanded world does not accommodate the game feel. San Andreas, GTA 4 and GTA 5 all have bigger open worlds than Vice City and therefore more to do in a sense (more time to waste). As a game, Vice City is the perfect GTA. Because, the open world is big, but not big enough for you to lose your way. Vice City is more simple and therefore better as a game. I never found myself wasting my time in Vice City. In San Andreas, GTa 4 and 5, myself and even you, always find yourself drivng around aimlessly, killing random people...sure this can be ammusing at the very least, but it won't compel you to keep playing the game. Vice City is a smaller game in scale and therefore the games design works.75/100

content:
Posted: September 26, 2013
												From 3 to Vice City even though this game was made in 8 Months after GTA 3 it is a much better game. The Vibe, Story, Graphics all of it sold this game for me. It is a fantastic experience. I liked the combat even though it wasn't too much improved from GTA 3. The Story is much better than 3 (The Main Character actually talks) and is a lot like the Movie Scarface. (Tommy Vircetti = Tony Montana pretty much)  The Radio has much more better tracks in my honest opinion.  (Even Michael Jackson is on the radio) The graphics were slightly better than 3 not too much improved but improved. The Missions range from assassinations to flying an RC helicopter or to being chased by a chef. Even if some missions are repetitive and annoying and if you fail it you have to DRIVE all the way back. The map is a 80's spoof of Miami, Flordia and it looks and feels fantastic. a All in all it is a fantastic experience and well worth the 10 dollars I spent on it. 8.5/10

content:
Posted: July 5, 2016
												Be Warned: There are some potentically game effecting bugs, but if you can get used to them, then you will enjoy the ride.1. The horizontal mouse sensitivity works like normal, but the vertical sensitivity seems to be locked at warp speed.2. The aim when shooting guns is off where the reticule shows the bullets should be going (you instead shoot up and to the right of the reticule).But besides those 2 things its GTA: Vice City 'nuff said.So if you can get used to not looking up and down much (which isnt actually that necessary for most of the game), and can get used to the aiming no being centered where the reticule shows then you will enjoy this. otherwise, if you feel these bugs will ruin your experience dont waste your money.

content:
Posted: January 11
												After playing GTA IV and GTA V, I had a problem going back to San Andreas. Something about it never seemed right. Vice City, however, it truly stood the test of time. I can still pick up this game and have a blast, going from mission to mission. While the story is not the most amazing thing in the world, it certainly offers enough to keep you engaged (at least the main missions do). This is a game I played a lot before I got my hands on GTA San Andreas, and I still find myself playing it on occasion.Do yourself a favor though, pick up the high-res mod to clean up the textures and get a proper fullscreen experience, and don't turn off the frame limiter. The game is funky about running higher then 30fps. (Though that can also be fixed with a patch)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 28
												Grand Theft Auto: Vice City.One of the best games in the 3D universe era of the GTA series. I used to play this game when I was younger. A portion of my childhood revolves around the classic GTA trilogy. When you're not on a mission, feel free to cause some havoc. Do whatever the hell you want without a care in the world, that is until the vigilance of the police puts a stop to your terror. The 1980's aesthetics and the overall atmosphere of the game are very pleasing to look at and the different radio stations you can listen to feature a lot of classic hits that are just wonderful to listen to as you play.I give this game a 9/10. Who cares if its graphics don't fit with today's style? Graphics don't determine if a game is good or not. It looks really nice, especially for its time, making its debut in late 2002. The early 2000's brought a lot of great games into existence, each unique and diverse in their own ways. GTA: Vice City has a lot of replay value with its various side missions, there's just so much you can do outside of the main story line. There's also 100 secret packages scattered throughout the world. Try to find them all, and you'll be rewarded handsomely with an arsenal of mass destruction and luxurious vehicles.My only problem with this game is that sometimes you can get stuck under a vehicle or rock and it's impossible to get out until you respawn or load the game from a save slot, and while there are a few other gamebreaking glitches, those only happen if the player makes them happen. Overall, this game is a bundle of fun and I definitely recommend it to anyone who hasn't played a GTA game before or just for nostalgic purposes.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												The second GTA game i played back in the day. Vice City came out on the PC in 2003, i picked it up and played it somewhere around 2005 to 2007. Quite possibly my favorite GTA of all time. Im a sucker for anything 80's so that further heightened the experience of this game. If you haven't played this one i would highly recommened playing it.The story is more intereresting than GTA 3 imo; it takes alot of cues from 80's films, and television. The aesthetics of the world really work in its favor and really makes you feel like your in the 80's. The various car designs, the npcs, and even the many easteregg references (Scarface mansion, Miami Vice music and cops) really addon to it.The gameplay is still the same from its predecessor. You have the ability to jump, run, sprint and crouch like GTA 3. There are new weapons in this GTA; compared to GTA3 having one set of weapons, GTA Vice City has atleast 4 sets of weapons from small to heavy.For the music you have yet again a really well picked soundtrack. You have a combination of 80's hip hop to Rock, to Newwave and Synthpop. The sound effects were well made for its time. As for the voice acting you have a couple of celebrities (Ray Liotta as Tommy Vercetti) Dennis Hopper, Burt Reynolds, Gary busey etc essentially a top notch performance and an interesting choice to have them voice the characters given their backgrounds.All in all, its well worth the money and its another great GTA experience.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
												I'm giving this game a good review, only because it is a classic Grand Theft Auto game and deserves recognition. Other than that, it performs horribly on a modern PC. You can say I have high standards, but the outdated settings and bugs make the game unplayable. The mouse sensitivity is extremely high, to the point that turning it all the way down doesn't help, it's maximum resolution is about a quarter of any screen made after 2006, and overall the controls are awkward and irritating. I'm sure there are mods out there to update the feel of the game, but for a user who wants it to be working right out of the box, they'll find themselves largely disappointed.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												Alright you sexy beasts, when you start up GTA VC, does it say "error 640x480 missing"? Well then luckly for you I have the power of google. So first off you amazingly hot people, you gotta go to This PC -->  Local Disk ----> Program Files (x86) -----> scroll down a little bit and go to Steam ----> SteamApps -----> common -----> find your GTA VC file through all of your other sexy games -----> right-click the icon that says "gta-vc" or "gta-vc.exe" ----> Click properties -----> click compatibility ----> turn off  "640x480 screen resolution" and change the "8-bit (256) color" to "16-bit (65536) color". Now it should work. This only helps people with the "640x480 missing" thing. If this doesn't work, Google search the way that works for you.   <3

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2012
												The best GTA game, hands down. Well, unless V is good but after IV.. Anyhow, the game is great, it's funny, it's got a PERFECT 80's atmosphere, with probably the most kickass soundtrack in a game. The radio has some witty banter, but the music is the best part. The graphics are a little aged but you can install some graphical mods if you're willing to learn a little bit about modding. The game is best played with a controller, but otherwise, it's Grand Theft Auto, the story is the best out of all of them, it's got likable characters and movie references all around. Everyone says San Andreas and IV are the best, but I can tell you, anyone who has played Vice City will tell you different. Just give it a go, most modern computers can run it and it's pretty cheap. If you're a fan of the series, do NOT pass this up. No complaints besides maybe it could do with a little better kb+m support.  9.8/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 15, 2014
												The 3D Grand Theft Auto that got me hooked. I was a fan of the original GTA on the Playstation. When I got older, I got the GTA III/ Vice City two pack for Xbox. I wasn't a big fan of III, but Vice City was, and still is, awesome. I love the setting. The music, the clothes, the culture, it's all cool. If you play this on the PC, I would recommend two mods. First is ginput, which allows you to play the game with the 360 controller. Make sure you download the extra stuff so it uses the same controls as GTA IV. The second is the widescreen patch. It fixes the aiming issues I was having while using widescreen mode.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2015
												One of the best GTA games second only to San Andreas imo.Considering it used the same engine as GTA 3, Rockstar really polished the ♥♥♥♥ outta this game by improving pretty much everything mechanics wise, like the cars longer being insanely dangerous to drive, better gunplay, flying, etc. It also introduced cool little things that are still present in current GTAs like buying properties. Vice City excels in atmosphere above anything else. Nothing like driving down Washington Beach at night listening to Flash fm to make you feel immersed. The graphics are very stylish with pretty lighting effects specially prominent at night. It also helps that the game has amazing radio stations that also give a bit of backstory to recurring radio stars in the franchise, like Laslow. Vice City feels very alive.Plot pretty much feels like a tribute to Scarface, this is clearly visible in the last mission. There's references to Carlito's Way and Miami Vice. The story features memorable characters and awesome moments with one of the best protagonists in the franchise. Tommy Vercetti is a ♥♥♥♥ing boss. I hope the next GTA takes us back to a remastered Vice City in the HD universe.

Product received for free
												So my review about GTA Vice City, I played this game since 2006 or so, back in the day it was the CD version, you needed 2 CDs one to install and one to play. It was such a great experience. It really made fun. I would give this game a 9 out of 10! Starting of with the good aspects:+ The feeling: you really feel like you are in the 80´s + The Soundtrack: Driving down the Highway listening to For little diamonds.. so awesome..+ The Story: Based on Scarface and Miami Vice it was just awesome to play it for yourself and become a Drug Boss and Bankrobber, just awesome+ The Main Charakter: Tommy Vercetti, you play as a Killer, a Thieb etc. but you are still charming and always leave your note, you know how to make someone talk, but you also know how to talk to a lady (even though you dont really do this)+ The Side Charakters: They just fit perfectly :) So the negative aspects: -  Swimming and Climbing: You can´t do this you cant swim and you cant climbe/ take cover or something like this. How you could later in GTA San AndreasSo over all: If you are no little child and dont care about the graphics (they are still awesome for the time)and you didnt play this game yet go buy it and play it it is awesome and you will have a good time.

												The game of my childhood and obviously the best Gta ever made. This game got all you want : a rich storyline, a game taking place in miami, a nice retro background, and high end graphics (when it was released).  This game really revolutionized the action and open world genre. Controls were better than Gta 3, physics were better than Gta 3, a real step forward.  The only Flop is that the steam version is trashy. Briefly this  game is a real gold mind for everyone that welcomes action and open world genre. A Guarenteed-Cult Game 10/10

content:
Posted: April 23
												I genuinelly want to love Vice City. I honestly do. GTA in the 80's? HELL YEAH! That sounds amazing! The aethsthetic of the 80's with its beautiful color pallete mixed with the tight controls and fun of GTA 3 sounds amazing to me. Unfortunately, due to whatever reason, this is not it. GTA: Vice City, at least for the Steam PC edition, is not a game I recommend.Even with mutlitudes of mods its still broken and clunky. While the game still looks relatively good for its time, the models don't hold up. This wouldn't bother me if the controls were tight. Yet, they're awful. Not what'd I expect from a Rockstar title in my life. Vehicles handle fine BUT YOU CAN BARELY REVERSE. You need to reverse to properly drive in a game where driving is IN THE NAME. This means you have 2 options if your car crashes. Spend 10 minutes driving in reverse 10 iph (inches per hour) or cut your losses and get another car or bike with the same issue. Tommy also has the Olympic prowess of a Paralympic Long Jumper, moving relatively okay but taking Neil Armstrong leaps forward. Not the worst but felt it needed mentioning.Don't get me started on the abhorrent shooting. You can't take aim, which is much worse than you thinkk, but your crosshair IS A LIAR. You don't shoot where it is, you shoot slightly diagonally of where it is, meaing shots are unprecise and clunky to say the least. The only way to fight is through melee or praying to the lord of the 80's himself RIck Astley that your pistol lands a shot. Everything else is fine however. The voice acting is good, the graphics, though aged, look nice and feel like Miami. However, without good gameplay this doesn't matter. Until Rockstar either remakes Vice City, controls and all, or fixes this version, I can't recommend it in good faith, as it feels more like a $0.99 Early Access game from Digital Homicide or something, not a game in the same tree as GTA IV or V. I hate to say it but I don't want someone like me getting all hype and being dissapointed in what was probably, in all honestly, a good PS2 game badly ported.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
												GTA Vice City set a new standard for all the titles in the series that proceeded it. It's my personal favourite title in the series and is of course very fun. A step up from GTA III, with a bright and vibrant palette, the inclusion of motorcycles and flyable aircraft, Vice City feels much more alive than Liberty City which came before it. The main story is also well done, with a very likable protagonist, Tommy Vercetti. Wreak havoc and have fun.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												The numerous bugs and glitches that plagued the PS2 version have been cleaned up and eliminated, for the most part. Enemies no longer shoot you through solid walls, you no longer randomly lose health while running, and cars remain in your garage until you take them out. The PC version of Vice City is just as much fun as the original, with great frame rates, better graphics, more control options, and all the content that made the PS2 version an instant classic. The mod community is still active and Vice City still works even on modern PC's unlike GTA IV which can be a pain to get working on a windows 8 and 10 machine. The controls can be a little frustrating at times when doing RC missions. Takes a little while to get the hang of it with keyboard and mouse, but if you have a gamepad, nothing to worry about. Still one of the best GTA games when it comes to story and voice acting. I am a saints row fan and most of the GTA's seem okay, but this one is fantastic. Who doesn't want to play as Ray Liotta? Your little version of Goodfellas. Still a classic and great game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Even after over ten years of break from playing the game. It just simply is the best GTA made in the series. Setting, musics, overall feeling is just so great. The city and surrounding areas are not too large so it isn't a modern sandbox game, instead everything is managable and city is very nice sized. Story is typical Hauser writing, but it works well here.Voice acting is top notch, with Ray Liotta leading the cast as the main character that you play as. The textures are from the early 2000's era, but if you can live with that, you are then ready for an ultimate experience in a great GTA world.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2015
												    Okay, I recomend this game because out of all the GTA's, this one is the only one that you can find a fast car/bike on almost every street corner. The downside of it is that any time you hit a wall, even if you just tapped it, you fall of your bike. I really like fast cars/bikes, but you need it so the guy doesn't fall off so much. I like the beach, how when you go on it you slow down, and I also like how it's so large. The colors arn't very diffrent, and by that I mean that every color has the same tint to it, if you know what I mean. (I'll update this when I've played the storyline. Why I writing a reveiw right now is to talk about the quality in the game, and I don't think I need to have played the storyline to tell you that.) All in all, great game, lots of fun, and a must-buy. A great game if you want a taste of how GTA works. (Ah, before I forget, you can only play this with a keyboard. No touchscreen support.)P.S. If you think that because I havn't played this game for long I can't give a true review, you are wrong. I have played 100+ hours of San Andreas on the window's store, so I'm comparing it to that one in particular. I have also played every GTA (Exsept for the first two that were 2D) out there, so I know what I'm talking about.                                                                                                                                                                                                   -Secretgamer

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												Nothing beats the memories of late nights with friends, auto-tuning to EMOTION 98.3 upon vehicle entry, taking turns doing progressively more outlandish 'runs' up and down the same stretch of road, barely dodging police tire strips at the last second, getting annoyed when the car catches fire in the middle of a great song, fleeing your busted ride while dodging unrelenting police AI and feeling that glimmer of hope when you spot an unexpected Cheetah nearby, only to have it slowly accelerate away just before you reach it, leaving you in a panic and forcing you to settle on a nearby Perennial station wagon, and when that one ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ police car that is designed to appear out of nowhere near intersections (to either t-bone you or have you t-bone it) causes you to flub your canal stunt jump setup juuuuust enough that you unsuccessfully land on the other side just mere inches short, you slowly rolling/sliding into the water, you know full well it's time to pass that controller to your friend because ol' Tommy Vercetti was never trained in the fine art of shallow water survival.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
												Ah, Grand Theft Auto: Vice City... The 80's. Nothing like experiencing the 80s as it was in Rockstar's own version of Miami, Florida. I'll be one to say that this game was literally the bread and butter of my childhood (Yeah, I know. Rated M for Mature for a reason. Shut up.) I tried to play it so much during the hours I was awake. I have even tried to fake sick to stay home from school to play this game. But enough about me and my experiences. Here's my review. A list of pros and cons. (Although there aren't many cons, if any, but anyway...)Pros:-The StoryThe story in itself is great while it lasts.-The voice actingSure, this can be sketchy with some games. However, with Vice City, this is definitely not a worry.-Ray LiottaC'mon. It's Ray Liotta playing a mad man. What more could you want? It's perfect.-The atmosphereWith this game, I always felt that you got that 1980s vibe from this game as it really brings out what that era was like, in my honest opinion.-Ray f**king LiottaDid I mention this already?Now, the cons...Cons-Not being able to swimWe are all used to it by now, but in Grand Theft Auto III, we all thought it was non-sense. Even I did. And that's about the only con this game had.Overall score is 10/10Ray motherf**king Liotta.Okay, I'm leaving this here now.:D

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												Nothing beats the memories of late nights with friends, auto-tuning to EMOTION 98.3 upon vehicle entry, taking turns doing progressively more outlandish 'runs' up and down the same stretch of road, barely dodging police tire strips at the last second, getting annoyed when the car catches fire in the middle of a great song, fleeing your busted ride while dodging unrelenting police AI and feeling that glimmer of hope when you spot an unexpected Cheetah nearby, only to have it slowly accelerate away just before you reach it, leaving you in a panic and forcing you to settle on a nearby Perennial station wagon, and when that one ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ police car that is designed to appear out of nowhere near intersections (to either t-bone you or have you t-bone it) causes you to flub your canal stunt jump setup juuuuust enough that you unsuccessfully land on the other side just mere inches short, you slowly rolling/sliding into the water, you know full well it's time to pass that controller to your friend because ol' Tommy Vercetti was never trained in the fine art of shallow water survival.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
												Ah, Grand Theft Auto: Vice City... The 80's. Nothing like experiencing the 80s as it was in Rockstar's own version of Miami, Florida. I'll be one to say that this game was literally the bread and butter of my childhood (Yeah, I know. Rated M for Mature for a reason. Shut up.) I tried to play it so much during the hours I was awake. I have even tried to fake sick to stay home from school to play this game. But enough about me and my experiences. Here's my review. A list of pros and cons. (Although there aren't many cons, if any, but anyway...)Pros:-The StoryThe story in itself is great while it lasts.-The voice actingSure, this can be sketchy with some games. However, with Vice City, this is definitely not a worry.-Ray LiottaC'mon. It's Ray Liotta playing a mad man. What more could you want? It's perfect.-The atmosphereWith this game, I always felt that you got that 1980s vibe from this game as it really brings out what that era was like, in my honest opinion.-Ray f**king LiottaDid I mention this already?Now, the cons...Cons-Not being able to swimWe are all used to it by now, but in Grand Theft Auto III, we all thought it was non-sense. Even I did. And that's about the only con this game had.Overall score is 10/10Ray motherf**king Liotta.Okay, I'm leaving this here now.:D

content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												best of the GTA series, easily!+tons of purchasable property that generates income or furthers the story(only old school gamers will understand why its a good thing to actually have to make some effort and be somebody important ingame to progress)+missions on said properties to unlock income generation or special bonuses+everything you do counts towards completion(stunt jumps, robbing stores, random side missions) something they seem to have forgotten about in newer games. i mean they are there but they dont count towards anything, so they are ultimately pointless. +everything you do is rewarding. for example, 100% completion unlocks things, doing ambulance missions, fire truck missions, give you perks. collecting packages gives you perks. things are actually rewarding. as the GTA series has progressed things have been less and less rewarding to where now you are just not rewarded at all for anything, its just optional things for "fun" or "flavour" b*llsh*t i want my actions to mean something. much more fun when you are actually rewarded for it.+ radio is amazing, the 80s were truly a great time to be alive+story is great, very well done, vercetti is an awesome character. much better than the trio of idiots in GTAV for sure. actually feels like a real character instead of you basically being a government hitman example: GTA:SA, GTAV (san andreas it only starts later on but you end up just being their ♥♥♥♥♥, as with GTAV the entire game your just the governments slave) with the exception of GTA4 where you are a badass ruski. although you do work with government/police a little bit, its minimal compared to the other two. yeah yeah i know its realistic but i dont care. i want to arrive in a city and make a name for myself like vercetti did. run♥♥♥♥♥♥and be a badass, not be a f*cking tool.+ controls are actually better than any of the newer games. the AI and phsyics are awful as to be expected from an old game such as this, but flight controls and mechanics, boat and vehicle controls are much better, even if they are way too responsive (you can make impossibly sharp turns in cars and boats) its actually much more fun that way.11/10!!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												I had fond memories of GTA:VC, thus I purchased the game. But when I played it again, I realized that the game didn't age well. Nonetheless, GTA:VC is, in my opinion, still the best entry in the GTA series. The locations, the beach and the sun makes you think more about your next vacation than about what is going on in the game, the retro style is cheesy but cool, and the characters may not be as realistic as the protagonists of later entries, but they are way more fun. Another thing I noticed is that the driving mechanics aren't realistic at all, but as a result driving a car down Vice City's streets provides more fun than "realistic" controls ever could. I still love the game, but I could not bring myself to play it more than two hours. I know that it is a superficial reason, but I couldn't stand the old graphics anymore.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												Following the success of Grand Theft Auto, developer Rockstar North takes gamers on a tour of a new city in Grand Theft Auto: Vice City. With new sights, new characters, new (ahem) business opportunities, and even a whole new '80s themed era, players can indulge in more criminal fun than ever before.Vice City features more expansive locations, and over 120 vehicles ripe for the picking such as exotic cars, motorcycles, luxury yachts and planes. The soundtrack boasts three times the tunes compared to the previous GTA, and features countless '80s hits. Over 40 different weapons ensure effective firepower and provide enough variety for stylish defensive measures (samurai sword anyone?).

content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												**TO ALL WHO ARE HAVING MOUSE ISSUES WITH THIS GAME**1. Run the game.2. Start Task Manager (Ctrl+Alt+Delete).3. Highlight the game then right click.4. Click "Go To Process".(should take you to the "Processes" page with GTA already highlighted)5. Right click the game and click on "Set Affinity".6. Then it's going to ask you "Which Processors Are Allowed To Run?".with the options to check on or off:_<All Processors>_CPU 0_CPU 1_CPU 2_CPU 37. Check <All Processors> off and only check on one CPU, doesn't matter which one, but I always just go with the first one: CPU 0.8. Click "OK" when chosen, close the Task Manager and click back on the game and all should be well.9. None of this will work if the game isn't already running before you open the Task Manager.**Note: This is the fix for Windows XP, Vista & 7, I do not own 8, but I would assume it's very similar, if not.. there's always YouTube lol**"other than that bulls**t and the fact that they took off some of the best songs in the game, it's still absolutely amazing to now own this on Steam, memories dog, memories"

content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
												After some thought, I had to come back and change my review. After reading other reviews I came to realize that I can't reccomend this game, at least not the steam version. Yes, it is a great game that will always hit a soft spot for me, but the way Rockstar has neglected the PC version is disappointing. The least they could do is update it to the Xbox version's graphics, or get GTA 3 to even work on newer systems (or to get this title to work without the 30 fps cap). But instead they only concentrate on how to push microtransactions in GTA5 Online (cars available in online only and not single play really lets me down). Really, over time it just shows more and more how Rockstar just loves money and not truely the fans of their games. If you really want this game do like I did, wait for a sale. My original review is below.I wish this was more of a port of the xbox version, or it got an anniversary update, with their graphical enhancements, but since I played this on PS2 anyway it deffinitly fills the nostalgia void. Especially since I have packed my PS2 away, it's easier to just open it up on steam, plus I get to play the story through one more time.

number of helpful: 2 of 8 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2016
												Unlike seemingly all other reviews of this game I had never played any of the playstation era GTAs; I had heard many times that this (or San Andreas) was the best GTA so I decided that it was worth having a go at, and without the nostalgia of having played this in its prime its clear that this game has aged very poorly. I don't mind the graphics or technical issues (the mouse acceleration is absolutely absurd) but the gameplay in general is just not fun; it's more of the "go here, shoot this" that practically all games share today but without the finese that all games share today; and that could be a good thing; older games often controlled and played poorly but did so in a way that made it feel unique (see Resident Evil, MGS3, Silent Hill, Thief, all the Interplay games, etc) but this simply feels like rushed design. Not to mention this games countless attempts at humor that just feel raunchy for raunchyness' sake without being funny.Every review I've read mentions the music and yes, this game has great music. But I can listen to music without playing a game.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
												If you are looking for Grand Theft Auto Vice City, then you've come to the wrong place. This game is but a mere shadow of what gta vice city was back in the day. It is filled with game-breaking bugs and glitches which will drive you up the wall. For instance, based off of my experience with this mess, vehicles could not reverse, some important characters would freeze during missions, cutscenes and various other things such as vehicles or characters will be dead silent due to missing audio files, the framerate would drop below 20 to 10 fps (even with my GTX 970 4GB v-ram), the game would constantly crash, save files would not work, the game was missing various textures, and alot of visual bugs alongside control issues with the mouse/keyboard. Rockstar, I have one thing to say to you, and one thing only. You should be ashamed of yourselves. I, and many others, gave you our money, and you gave us this. But I digress, if you are looking for GTA Vice City, then you've come to the wrong place. Get a ps2, get GTA VC for the ps2, and enjoy the ride. Or even get the ps3 version of Vice City (If that one is not a mess too). ...........also the more recent versions of this game (ps3/pc) are missing alot of music because copyright.....

number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												Vice City is one of the best if not THE best GTA.The sound track is awesome. The story isn't bad either. This game and Scarface share a lot of similarities with one another. I believe that was on purpose and why not that was also an awesome film.Unfotunately the control scheme on this PC version is utter dogsh*t. There is supposed to be controller support but it is totally f*cked. Get on a bike using a controller and the bike sways from side to side as the game struggles to make heads of tails of the buttons on the controller and fails.The controls really ruins the experience. I LOVE this game but I can't recommend this version to you. Sure there are controller mods but they shouldn't be necessary and it seems to me to be hit and miss whether the mod will even work.I would honestly suggest buying the game and then playing it on an emulator. So you have the moral high ground in the sense that you didn't just steal the game but you get a better version. That will have proper controller support and will possible look better with the emulator upscalers.

number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
												Now I remember why I couldn't finish the game back in time... and why I didn't like GTAs until very soon. In Vice City, the controls are just f*cked up, pushing the difficulty way too high. One of the FIRST mission is to destroy a building with small helicopters... had to redo the mission maybe 10 times. At the middle of the game, one of the mission is to recover some drug cases, with a time limit and with multiple SWAT troops / spike strips coming from nowhere... just impossible, unless you redo the mission maybe 50 times... or with cheat codes. And I am not a noob...The rest of the game is like all GTAs : take a car, go there, shoot them, take a car, chase them, take the case, go there... etc. No intellectual challenge, no surprises. Even the scenario is so so... The best GTAs are still (in order) 5 then 4, as the controls are much better, and the level of details also higher. They are also more different in their missions.Really, this Vice City was overrated back in time - even if it has some new really good features (open world for example) - and it is much worse playing it today...

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												Every now and then i buy an old classic that i missed at the time in the hope it will still kick♥♥♥♥♥today. You win some, you lose some. I remember loving the ads for this game. Hearing all those great tunes and watching your guy drive around in a Ferrari like Sonny Crocket was magical. Unfortunately, after almost 12 years of anticipation, i realize the actual gameplay isn't.I think the biggest problem is that it is a console game. The save system is absolutely abysmal. You need to drive 5 minutes to some out-of-the way checkpoint to save, then you need to spend another 5 minutes driving back to the guy who gives you your mission, then your mission sends you 5 minutes driving somewhere else, then if you die on your mission, you are forced to repeat 10+ minutes of garbage time just to get where you were when the action started. This would have been bad enough in 2001, but in 2015 when there are thousands of other games on Steam it's unforgivable. Woeful checkpoint system aside, the mouselook is really jerky and it's almost impossible to aim your guns or fight on foot. Pretty much the only thing that rocks in this game is driving around aimlessly in a Ferrari listening to synthpop, and then i might as well just be watching Miami Vice in the first place.

content:

												**New Review (old one below)**I don't know why, maybe it's the story, or the setting. But for some reason I'm giving this one another try, and recording my play through of it. Apparently one of the problems I had (which no one brought up here) is that trying to play this and GTA III in wide screen messes with your aiming a lot. Also I just can't stand the system controlls, they get far to clunky when you need them the most. So far, after fixing the game again, and going back to PC controlls, I've played up to just before the last Cortez mission before he takes off. No deaths, and aiming is much improved. Hope the gun bugs don't come back to haunt me again. (PS2 version your guns can randomly lock up and get you killed.) But those Helicopter controls WTF!? So clunky. Any fixes for this? So far I have W to go up S to go down, A and D lean, and then I have to use, on my numpad 9 to go foreword and 4 and 5 to turn.****Original Review****Just like GTA III. You need to fix this game just to make it playable, and even then there are so many unfair and bull♥♥♥♥♥♥missions, you can't win without cheating. Fix this mess, or stop selling it. content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
												While this game is great, the Steam versions are riddled with massive glitches that make it nearly unplayable. Either Steam hates Rockstar or Rockstar hates Steam, as this is the only reason that can explain how insanely difficult it is to get some of these classics to work on newer OS and graphics cards. Ever single one of these Steam ports (III, Vice City, and VI) has some serious glitch that requires far more tweeking and adjustments to the launch settings than necessary. And not once has either Steam or Rockstar done a single thing to fix any of them. Instead, you buy an unplayable game, one that won't even start up, one that you cannot get a refund on, and neither company gives a damn. It's the equivalent of buying a hard copy game, opening it up, and realizing there is a manufacturer error that makes it unusable, and both the manufacturer and the merchant who sold it to you have an attitude of "Oh well, you got what you paid for, sucks to be you. Don't bother asking us to fix it, we don't care." And before you think this is just one person's system issues, go look in the forum at how many people can't get the game to start and how there is zero assistance from Steam or Rockstar, as neither are trying to solve these issues or fix the digital copies they fraudulently sold people, knowing full and well that it did not work with a newer OS. Compound that with the fact that these problems have been ongoing for almost 4 YEARS with no real resolution, and you can understand why I cannot recommend this version of GTA Vice City to anyone.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
PROS:+ fantastic & cool story+ amazing soundtrack+ very fun gameplay+ lots of side missions+ no Rockstar Games Social ClubCONS:- sometimes clunky combat- falling into water still kills you- compatibility issues with newer OS- lots of glitches - audio, graphic- mouse control issues- game freezing in menusComment:With a heavy heart I have to explain why I cannot recommend getting this game on Steam. The game itself is great even though there are issues with it. The most apparent issues are with compatibility, mostly on Windows 7, 8, 8.1 and 10. Problems ranging from audio and graphic glitches ... screen/game freezing .. to mouse controls not working properly. But you could expect these for an old game and many (if not all) can be fixed by adding fixes/workarounds. Now to the core of the game. I remember it fondly playing it over a decade ago. The gangster story, all the vehicles there for you to use, cool missions and side-missions, adult humor. To this day I remember all the little details about it. Yes, the combat was and still is clunky but who cares when it is fun. An added bonus is that you do not have to deal with RGSC in this game. The game is awesome and is missing just a bit more polish to be as good as the sequel - San Andreas. But just like SA it suffers from licensing and how Rockstar treats digital distribution of games. Because you DO NOT OWN IT when you buy it here, you just borrow it. They might change the game when they wish and as recent events have shown they can remove stuff. Songs, options, fixes and in this way also all of the mods made throughout the years. Sometimes they swap it with a mobile port entirely. Vice City already had stuff removed and this will go on in the future. So as time goes your copy of the game on Steam gets worse and worse ... while old disk copies and even pirated versions remain the best quality available. THIS is why I do not recommend buying it here.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
												My thumbs down is for this steam version being unplayable because of random crashes, otherwise this is one of the best games ever made, if not the single best. Despite being unplayable because of crashing, I gave a review below of my experience of this game from the Playstation 2 days. I don't recommend buying this on steam because you will probably have problems launching it and probably have crashes in-game. The game wouldn't launch so I messed around with DEP. That didn't work. So I tried using the DEP on the testapp.exe file and it didn't work. I then set the testapp.exe to run in windows xp service pack 3 mode and as administrator and the game finally worked. However after playing for about an hour, the game gave me the same crash error that it did when I was trying to launch it before which is a "unhandled exception" error. I set it to Windows 7 compatibility mode and it will now run again but probably not for long until it gives me that crash error. So basically I will not fk around with this anymore. That and you need to fix your Y sensitivity outside of the game because it is way too high in the game. I had to enable X and Y sensitivity sliders in my Razer Synapse software and set the Y sensitivity all the way down to 300 while leaving the X at 1300. Because of awful crash trouble, I can't recommend anyone to buy this. What I do recommend is buy a PS2 and this game and have a blast because it is worth it. Or PCSX2 and a rom.What's to say? It is simply one of the best games ever made, and one of the most important. It helped change how games were made and made people rethink what a video game really is. And of course the most awesome part, the soundtrack. One of the best ever. Imo it's pretty much the only GTA game to have a good soundtrack. The soundtracks to 3, 4, and 5 are garbage, and San Andreas only has a few good tunes. I remember being absolutely blown away by this game when it was released all those years ago and I had it for my Playstation 2. I've been a gamer since the 80's and I have seen and played a lot, and very few games have ever blown me away like this one did. Some of the most fun I have ever had was with this game. And a 19 yr old girl. Nothing but good memories. Of course games now are far better quality, but for its time, this game was phenomenal, and it still holds up well and is still fun to play. It showcases some of the best 80's music that there is and captures 80's Miami perfectly. Great weapons, great missions (mostly), a lot of fun killing everyone, driving fast, driving boats and helicopters, and the map layout is great. Vice City is a awesome place to be.

Posted: May 20, 2015
												There's a special place in my heart for Vice City. I love the asthetics, the music, and the protagonist, but this game has not aged well. The controls are all by unplayable, the aim is off, the movement is clunky and stop-start, and your health will drop faster than your desire to play this game after the nostalgia has worn off.I want to like this game, but frankly, I can't stand it anymore. It just isn't fun. The difficulty is too high, the controls are too bad, and the good points don't outweigh the bad. I recommend you go get yourself "Scarface: The World Is Yours" instead.

content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
BEWARE, LIKELY INCOMPATIBLE WITH YOUR WINDOWS OSJust like its predecessor, Grand Theft Auto: Vice City became the best selling video game of the year (2002), garnering praise for its story and open-ended gameplay, but also criticism for recurring violent and sexual themes.Unfortunately, the game is unlikely to run on any modern computers.  The game's readme does not even list Windows Vista, let alone later operating systems.  The following fixes failed to start the game:1. Replace/Delete .set file from GTA Vice City User Files.2. Turn off Data Execution Prevention for both gta-vc.exe and testapp.exe.3. Run gta-vc.exe and testapp.exe in compatibility mode.4. Run gta-vc.exe and testapp.exe as administrator directly from game files.However, if you still need your GTA fix, Grand Theft Auto V should do the trick.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												This isn't a review of the specific game but a warning that may not work if you are using a modern PC. The game's engine is connected with the game's framerate, thus framerate limiter needs to be on for the game to work properly. If you don't have the limiter on the game appears to run smoothly but your car will be moving slower, and you will not be able to back up in the car (this applies to all vehicles, this makes the boat missions impossible, and any racing mission is impossible). There are also varous glitches that happen during missions because the engine wasn't design to be played at a high framerate. So why not play with the framerate limiter on? Well for me the game looks horribly choppy with it on, with noticable drops in frames continously. The game may work better if you have an old processor or graphics card possibly? I would recommend just getting it on the PS2 where you know it will work and you will have better controls too!
