number of helpful: 3 of 25 people (12%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												On the playstation 2 I absolutely loved GTA:Vice city. Before I get into particulars i'll broad-stroke the premise. GTA: Vice city was launched for the PS2. It can best be described as a sandbox adventure game. Youre given various missons and objectives by people and advance the game by completing these missions. Theres not a whole lot of missions aside from the main story but who needs sidequests when you are wreaking havock at every turn?       A large part of this game is the fun you make for yourself. Walking into this I was very excited to relive some old memories with crispy graphics, tiny load times and nearly endless draw distance. What I found was just that, except for a few small details that ended up being big problems. Remember on the good ol' PS2 when you would boot up Vice City and you had the time to walk away, get some snacks, maybe use the bathroom and sit back down and only have to wait a few moments more for the initial load? No more! Load times and load zones are no longer an issue here.       So was pretty stoked. I couldnt wait to see all(or most) of vice city rendered as once in the highest of resolutions. And this game delivered that for me too. It was a wonderful trip down memory lane, that is, until I had to take control of the main character. Unfortunately, the controls dont translate well to mouse and ketboard. At first it wasnt a problem, I used a ps3 controller. There are too many commands that have to be mapped to too many buttons, it wont let you have the same controls that you did on the PS2 version. I tried many different control schemes and ideas but none worked the way I really wanted them to. Eventually I gave up.          There ARE programs and doodads that you can use that should give you a better expierience with the controls. Also, vice city is very playable as is, out-of-the-box. I just couldnt get comforable with any controll schemes I tried.  If youre looking for a GTA game you can play on an older computer I'd reccomend GTA:San Andreas. It's slightly more easier to play on mouse and keyboard. If you are looking for a little bit of nostalgia, you would be better off booting up you PS2, and digging out your old copy.

												I Forgot how much fun I had on this game.I used to sit awake all night slaughtering civilians and popping police.For us, this was our GTA V.It was awesome in every way.I wonder if I'll have any fun if I were to purchase it again?.....Hellz Yea!OK, don't forget, this was 2002 ppl. 1 Year after the amazing release of GTA 3, the part where GTA went from 2D to 3D. Being able to steal any vehicle you see was a huge leap forward in video gaming.This game, Vice City, was a mere 1 Year after the release of this technology.Sure they used basically the same engine and just made it a little better.But the point is, I had fun...again. and again. and again.I sometimes find myself coming back to play it instead of GTA V, just for a bit of nostalgia value but also the storyline is quick and action packed.I love being able to beat a pedestrian to a pulp then watching the paramedics revive them, only to be beaten to a pulp again....revived....beaten....revived...beaten...does this make me sick?anyway, I had fun, maybe you will too.Its 80's , looks like it belongs in the 80's, but if can deal with old graphics, you will probably have some fun.If you don't like 80's music, this game probably isn't for you.Maybe go play some gansta♥♥♥♥♥♥instead.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 10
												GTA: Vice City is set in the most magical time period of the whole Grand Theft Auto series. It has a certain charm that the other games certainly haven't accomplished to the same degree. The soundtrack is one of the most beautiful, and breathtaking soundtracks in all of gaming. The radio commentators are hilarious and witty, and they accompany the music wonderfully. Fernando Martinez from Emotion 98.3 is a prime example of this, constantly commenting about the way he flirts with women, and other things. The gameplay of this game has always been incredibly fun, but to today's standards, it is pretty barren and empty mechanically. There is no cover system, but you can crouch behind things. Weapons shoot in a very curved way if you leave Widescreen turned on. It looks pretty bad on a 16:9 monitor when using widescreen off. The driving is very arcade-y and turning is very rapid and overall works nicely. The city of Miami (Vice City), however, is the main highlight. This is not only one of the most memorable video game maps of all time, it is also... a beautifully remarkable city of pure nostalgia. While it is minuscule in size by comparison to other GTA maps, it sticks with you forever, especially if you played this game for hundreds of hours as a kid. The game makes me feel like I am back at home, which is an extraordinary feeling. While it certainly is a bit short, (took me 10 hours to beat - a bit of a rushed playstyle, and used weapon cheats only). Storywise, it will remind you of classics such as Scarface. This is definitely a recommendation, but I also recommend modding it to bring it a bit more to today's standards.10/10 for the time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 3, 2013
												Grand Theft Auto Vice City (GTA:VC) is a throwback to the 80s pop culture and takes a number of cues from movies that were big in that awesome decade.This game takes place in Vice City which is, basically, Miami. However, it's Miami of the 80s. There is a certain Miami Vice vibe to the game as well as Scarface and other such movies that were popular at that time.You play as hitman Sonny Vercetti who has recently been released from prison. He goes down to Vice City, at the behest of the mob boss he works for, to get in on the Miami action. Like the Miami of the 80s drugs and drug running/smuggling plays a big part of the story. It's a sandbox game but it's also an empire building game.Vice City is beautiful and fun to explore. You'll find hidden easter eggs, if you look hard enough, like the shower scene from Scarface.Another great thing about this game is the music. Rockstar licensed real music from the 80s and it goes together with the gameplay experience well. Sometimes it's satisfying to cruise around Vice City while listening to 80s music. In a way it really takes you back.If you are a fan or child of the 80s and enjoyed Grand Theft Auto III you would do well to pick this up. If only they would remake this using higher poly models and higher screen resolutions.

												This game is an upgrade of Grand Theft Auto III. It has the same mechanics and physics of Grand Theft Auto III. 												GTA: Vice City é um ótimo jogo. Mesmo sendo um jogo de 2003, é um jogo com gráficos legais e jogabilidade ótima. Nós controlamos o mafioso Tommy Vercetti na cidade de Vice City, podendo atravessar o mapa com carros, motos, helicópteros, etc. Tudo começa com uma negociação em 1986 com o ex-chefe de Tommy, Sonny Forelli, essa negociação era sobre drogas, mas acabou sendo uma armadilha para Tommy. Tommy consegue fugir, e assim começa a história do jogo, conhecemos mais personagens ao longo da história para ajudar Tommy a recuperar o dinheiro envolvido na negociação que deu errado. Recomendo muito o jogo!

content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												Amazing game. Completed in 12 hours (all missions) but only 44%.This percentage leads me to believe the game is amazingly dense with lots of things to do, etc.The soundtrack is by far the best on the series and one of the best on the industry. It got really hard for me to leave the cars, consideing I would not hear music.However, there's an issue. Two actually :- The Crosshair, on widescreens or resolutions that are 16:9, is inaccurate. The center dot is above the line of fire, so aim a bit up for headshots;- The mouse sensitivity is enourmous and inaccurate as well. In fact, the Y axis isn't the same as the X axis. You may have to lower the sens. on windows or download a file to fix the issue. Rockstar should really look into it.Apart from that, amazing game, awesome soundtrack and lots of fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 23, 2014
												Vice City is the next installment of the GTA franchise after 3. Taking place in Vice City, one of the cities based off Hawaii, you play as Tommy Vercetti, a made-man on the Forelli family. After being setup by your don, Sonny Forelli to be killed, you survive the vicious encounter and police forces arrest you on 10 counts of murder and are imprisoned for 15 years effectively being named as the "Harwood Butcher". After Sunny, one of your next of kin gets you out of jail, you try to hit up a deal with Vic Vance to pay off old debts by taking a flight from Liberty City to Vice City...however not everything comes to plan. Vic Vance is assassinated, the money is stolen, leaving Sonny in doubt of the loyalty of Tommy who has to take over Vice City to pay the debt off.Vice City introduced many features such as property ownage (able to buy properties in different islands), manage assets for profit, added and tweaked side-missions, full voice acting cast (Tommy himself is voice acted) and brilliant open-world experience. Classic and recommended. Install SilentPatch and his Y-AXIS fix to play the game like it was intended.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 13, 2015
												Well, i've got to be honest. It's a horrible port. I'm running on windows 8 and there are a lot of problems. When I first hopped into the game I wanted to change the mouse sensitivity because it was too high. So I got it to a respectable level, but here's the thing. I got it to a respectable level across the X axis. Forget about aiming up and down. You so much as breath on the back of your mouse and your aiming goes into hyperspeed. I also wanted to run the game at 60+fps so there is a helpful option which I turned off called frame limiter. Yeap, I was getting great fps but there is a catch. The cars go to♥♥♥♥♥♥ Seriously, they just decide to not work properly at all, (You can't even reverse). I also ran across another horrible thing about 1 hour into the game. I was doing a mission where you fly a sort of drone thing, so I was expecting the usual sort of wasd and an ascend/descend button. Nope, instead you get this god awful button layout for controlling it, something along the lines of 9 to go forward, q to rotate clockwise and then some other numpad buttons to control it mixed in with wasd. I don't even know how I managed to get through that mission XDAnways, if you can get past the bad port, and the buggyness, underneath all that is a truely beautiful game. This really is so fun to play. Don't feel put off by reading my review. This still is a great game and definitly deserves to be played and enjoyed.

												Vice City may not have the fancy graphics nor as much interactivity as it's later siblings, but to me the storyline, graphic style, music and setting of Vice City, all combine perfectly to produce a sublime whole that has yet to be beaten. It's the only game other than Minecraft where I have found myself on a beach, watching the sunset and enjoying every second of it. So if you are late to the series and passed this one by cos 'it's old', do yourself a favour and give it a try - you won't regret it.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												I love it, I can't stop playing, my keyboard is getting mashed up, my spaceba and WASD keys are getting smothend out because of all the tapping i'm doing playing. My freaking keyboard got noticably eroded within weeks of buying the game. Crazy fun, not to many planes, but some helicopters, funny as ♥♥♥♥ radio stations. I suggest listening to VCPR, it's crazy. Or KCHAT. Some times i've driven around SPECIFICLY to listen to the radio stations, there's some pretty good music on them too. I love the non-stop action, humor and just satasfaction in this GTA game, taking a perfectly fine city and puting a single virus in it capable of causing mass destruction,and that virus is you. The character's looks can be a little weird at times. But it's not like that really matters. There's crazy stunts to do all across the map, tons of cars, even a tank at one mission. It's a great game, fun as hell to watch, and play. And the story is nice too, how you grow up working for the big guys in town, eventually you become the big guy. Perfect, 9/10. ONLY because of the lack of aircraft, if there was a plane or two i'd probably give it a 10/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												This is easily my favorite GTA game in the franchise. The story is alright but really, who plays GTA for the story? This game is jam packed with unique and thrilling missions that keep you playing. Vehicles aren't really a huge part of the game but nonetheless there is quite the variety to choose from. To top it all off this game is jam packed with hilarious and interesting easter eggs. Literally. But it is not a perfect game by no means. The control is a little wonky at times and the driving is not the best. At the end of the game (no spoilers) you need to collect money for the final mission and the way you get money takes WAY too long if you do not do the process of getting these money making means before hand. But other than a few minor complaints, I CANNOT suggest this game any more. If you like games that can suck you in for hours and hours without you knowing then buy this game immediately!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 9, 2012
												GTA games all seem to be good. Some are better than others, this is one of those, infact the best of the GTA's I have bought this game so many times due to loss, different platforms, etc. I do not regret buying it any of the times. My brother introduced me to this game,  at first i would just watch him play for hours (yes, even that was fun) and when I was allowed to play I didn't stop for quite a while, I rember recommendin L4D2 and saying that it was 'the best FPS game ever!'  I was wrong as I clearly didn't think of this game, this is not just the best FPS game ever, it is the BEST GAME ever.For just £5.99, 7.25 EUR or $9.29 This is a bargain for that price, (prices may be different from time of recommedation) normally you get rubbishy little games for £6, Vice City is so under-rated because it is dated, but it was only 2 years before San-Andreas (Another good one by the way) yet everyone seems to dismiss VC.I really can't say enough to explain how amazingly outstanding...

												If Miami Vice was a game, I'd buy it and play nothing else.As it stands though, we have Vice City and that is absolutely enough for me. The soundtrack, the colours, the fashion, all the cars and boats and golf courses and oh my gosh... number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 20, 2015
												First of all this game is really good but has a few problems but also improved on a few mistakes gta 3 made.The first time i played this was an illegal version a friend gave me but the game crashed on the riot mission so it wasnt much good to me. I decided to buy the GTA 3 trilogy bundle and i wasnt dissapointed by any of these 3 games. GTA 3 was the first i played and GTA SA the first i owned and my favourite GTA and maybe my favourite game ever but this game ws different to both of those in a few ways and similar in a few ways too and the same as gta 3 in many ways, let me explain why.The Game is on the same engine as GTA 3 and the graphics, sounds, hud and a bunch of other things like the fact that you cant swim are all identical to GTA 3 but the hud is a different colour, but all this makes me realise how different GTA SA was to these 2 games, i havn't completed this game and have only got 3.3 hours at the time of this review but i enjoy it although the mission "demolition man" i one of the most frustrating missions in gta and made number 2 on the WatchMojo - "top 10 hardest GTA missions" video which you should all watch (shout out to them) but otherwise the game is amazing, now let me tell you the things it improved on and the things it did badPros - Protagonist is now fully voiced unlike gta 3, more weapons, good weather effects, good cars and other vehicles, bikes and helicopters were added and drivable and so were boats but im not sure if they were in gta 3 or not (you could drive one in a mission though), good story, good characters.Cons - Didnt like the music (my opinion), some boring and or hard missions were in there, small map, same engine/graphics/sounds as gta 3, cant swim, cops are hard to lose sometimes which applies for gta 3 aswell, poorly explained mission objectives (for some missions anyway), bad combat system but still better than gta 3 but only by a bit, cars feel really slow sometimes and really fast other times.Otherwise great game and gets 8 out of 10.

												If you've played shooters for a while you obviously have heard of GTA Series but, Vice City is very unique. This and Vice City Stories are the only games in the GTA Series to be based in Miami, Florida. It is based in the 1980s with your main characters name is Tommy. Tommy is a white male that is trying to give his friend Sonny his drug money back from a fail of a deal. Graphics are outdated but, I dont mind it's still a fun action packed game. If you are a fan of GTA and like the older games in the series such as GTA : Sandreas I fully recommend to play through Vice City.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
												Fun and enjoyable, has an amazing soundtrack and a pretty good story. tommy (the main protaganist) isnt all that likable (well to me he isnt) but it doesnt really take away from the overall experience with the game. although i have had some problems with the frame rate and some controls not working when you turn off the frame limiter. if you can deal with those small problems then it is definetely worth a buy in my opinion. if you have are used to a smooth 60 fps on all your games and you dont think you could handle your frames being limitied to 30 fps, and a fair bit of stuttering every now and then. i dont reccomend that you get this game. but if there was one piont of vice city that i would like to push on you, it is the soundtrack. it is great and there is a radio station for pretty much everyone. but if you are after that 1980s miami vibe i would suggest Emotion.so once again, if you arent too bothered with not having a flawless and mooth experience, get this game. but if you are one of the few that could not handle even looking at a game unless it is running at a buttery 60 fps. i suggest you to give this game a shot, it really is great. and if you dont like it its not much money wasted. its GTA vice city after all

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 5, 2015
												In my humble opinion, still the best GTA title to date (I haven't played GTAV yet, so that might change). Yeah, sure, you can do more stuff in other GTA games, but this one has that impossible "duende", that.,. vibe. The vibe is perfect, the story (although a ripoff from Scarface) is great and the CHARACTERS, oh my, the CHARACTERS. Go take your Trevors and Michaels and CJs and Claudes and take them to school - *this* is how you make characters. All of them are nuts and over the top, as they should be for a GTA game, but they have that... that... something that just makes them so memorable, from the snow-abusing Rosenberg to the charismatic Colonel Cortez, Tommy himself of course just oozes bada$$ery in every way possible.The graphics are old and fugly for today's standards, but I don't care. My real problem is the lack of widescreen support, but there is a very good and reliable widescreen fix available on the interwebz somewhere, so that takes care of that. Uzi. Cheetah. Sunshine. VRock. Delve in and cry when it's over.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												Amazing game. Completed in 12 hours (all missions) but only 44%.This percentage leads me to believe the game is amazingly dense with lots of things to do, etc.The soundtrack is by far the best on the series and one of the best on the industry. It got really hard for me to leave the cars, consideing I would not hear music.However, there's an issue. Two actually :- The Crosshair, on widescreens or resolutions that are 16:9, is inaccurate. The center dot is above the line of fire, so aim a bit up for headshots;- The mouse sensitivity is enourmous and inaccurate as well. In fact, the Y axis isn't the same as the X axis. You may have to lower the sens. on windows or download a file to fix the issue. Rockstar should really look into it.Apart from that, amazing game, awesome soundtrack and lots of fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												Step 1: Find game with better soundtrackStep 2: Come to terms with your failure Additional Information: There is one thing I know for sure: each of us will fail, at something, at some point. The question is: what will we do about it?All successful people I know attribute part of their success to failure. Though it’s usually painful, we learn from failure. I know that my own failures, and there have been many, have planted the seeds for future success and constant humility I carry with me like a small talisman.Failure forces you to become resilient. We’ve all heard of denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance; they are the steps one follows to get through grief. I came to realize that one could have a plan of action for coming to terms with failure — a roadmap to help find your way out of despair and build resilience to make you stronger for certain other failures that await.I began as an investment manager in the late 1980’s fresh out of Wharton. Having had consistent success since then, it is hard to believe that the heady days of early 1998 would set the stage for a stunning and swift near collapse of my firm and career.Things couldn’t have been going better. My firm was coming off a hot streak of several years. We were growing and making good money for our clients, and therefore good money for ourselves. We had just negotiated the sale of half our business for an enormous sum, meaning I would have officially “made it” at 33 years old. That is until the summer of 1998.A tornado hit the financial markets as Russia defaulted on their debt and the collapse of Long Term Capital Management seemed to bring Wall Street to its knees. (A crisis, when compared to the crisis of 2008, could best be described as adorable.)Our funds quickly headed south and we weren’t well positioned to save them. We made many mistakes; some due to hubris, some due to poor judgment, some due to poor efforts keeping investors informed.When the deal to sell half the firm was terminated by the buyer in the fall of 1998, our business was in shambles. Adding salt to the wound, the market rallied strongly in the end of ’98, making our relatively poor performance that much worse. My failure thoroughly in place, and my ego and self-esteem in tatters, I waited for the dust to settle. The stage was set. I could either be resilient or decide to be washed up at 33.Opting to be courageous, I devised a step-by-step plan to find my way back after a really big moment of underachieving. I’ve found that deliberate planning helps me get to a place where I can have the objectivity to learn from a debacle.And really, if you can’t learn anything from failing, what good is it anyway?Here are my steps:1.    Allow yourself a very short, defined moment of wallowing in the failure. Maybe you give in and permit yourself one weekend of binge TV watching, laying on the couch and eating crap. Do not, however, let this step drag on.2.    Get back in the game, even if you have to play hurt.  Fake that you’re ok. It’s completely acceptable to know you are faking your resilience at this point.  You can’t expect immediate results, but you can act confidently knowing one-day things will be ok.3.    Recalibrate what’s important. Here’s a moment to reassess what your priorities are and revise how you’ve been spending your time, if necessary. If you’ve lost a really important promotion, a long sought after election, or an end to a relationship, you’re going to feel pain for a really long time. The bigger and more unique the failure, the harder it will be to imagine that you could ever feel better. Very often a big failure leaves you with more time on your hands than you thought you would have. Finding solace in a new interest or self-improvement you’ve always meant to try should be high on your priority list.4.    Re-visit. This is an important step that is both immediate and serves the long term.  On the heels of your great catastrophe, write yourself a letter and be sure to include everything you’re thinking; every pain, every embarrassment, every feeling of loss or shame. Put the letter away. Take it out six months later and evaluate how much these intense feelings of hurt have subsided. Time heals wounds, fades lines in the sand, and opens never-before considered perspectives.5.    Change up your routine to help you find a new normal. However, keep some semblance of order. Make your bed everyday…literally.These steps have helped me more than once. I’m lending them to you because fortunately for the moment I’m not using them (though I’m sure I will again).The goal, forever and always, is to be in a position to learn from failure, for that is its gift. It will lead you to future successes and ultimately help shed the fear that failure often brings.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												If your looking for a review on GTA Vice City you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

												To me, Vice City is the best Grand Theft Auto game, period! I have played every GTA since the first one (which is a blast by the way) and was dissapointed by the stereotypical tone and gameplay of San Andreas. Vice City on the other hand is very clever in it's writing, the sandbox element is great, the soundtrack is one of the best in video game history (look it up if you don't believe me) and the "sexual content" is not tastless and vulgar as the last two games. Vice City had that cool 1980s feel and I loved it.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												Step 1: Find game with better soundtrackStep 2: Come to terms with your failure Additional Information: There is one thing I know for sure: each of us will fail, at something, at some point. The question is: what will we do about it?All successful people I know attribute part of their success to failure. Though it’s usually painful, we learn from failure. I know that my own failures, and there have been many, have planted the seeds for future success and constant humility I carry with me like a small talisman.Failure forces you to become resilient. We’ve all heard of denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance; they are the steps one follows to get through grief. I came to realize that one could have a plan of action for coming to terms with failure — a roadmap to help find your way out of despair and build resilience to make you stronger for certain other failures that await.I began as an investment manager in the late 1980’s fresh out of Wharton. Having had consistent success since then, it is hard to believe that the heady days of early 1998 would set the stage for a stunning and swift near collapse of my firm and career.Things couldn’t have been going better. My firm was coming off a hot streak of several years. We were growing and making good money for our clients, and therefore good money for ourselves. We had just negotiated the sale of half our business for an enormous sum, meaning I would have officially “made it” at 33 years old. That is until the summer of 1998.A tornado hit the financial markets as Russia defaulted on their debt and the collapse of Long Term Capital Management seemed to bring Wall Street to its knees. (A crisis, when compared to the crisis of 2008, could best be described as adorable.)Our funds quickly headed south and we weren’t well positioned to save them. We made many mistakes; some due to hubris, some due to poor judgment, some due to poor efforts keeping investors informed.When the deal to sell half the firm was terminated by the buyer in the fall of 1998, our business was in shambles. Adding salt to the wound, the market rallied strongly in the end of ’98, making our relatively poor performance that much worse. My failure thoroughly in place, and my ego and self-esteem in tatters, I waited for the dust to settle. The stage was set. I could either be resilient or decide to be washed up at 33.Opting to be courageous, I devised a step-by-step plan to find my way back after a really big moment of underachieving. I’ve found that deliberate planning helps me get to a place where I can have the objectivity to learn from a debacle.And really, if you can’t learn anything from failing, what good is it anyway?Here are my steps:1.    Allow yourself a very short, defined moment of wallowing in the failure. Maybe you give in and permit yourself one weekend of binge TV watching, laying on the couch and eating crap. Do not, however, let this step drag on.2.    Get back in the game, even if you have to play hurt.  Fake that you’re ok. It’s completely acceptable to know you are faking your resilience at this point.  You can’t expect immediate results, but you can act confidently knowing one-day things will be ok.3.    Recalibrate what’s important. Here’s a moment to reassess what your priorities are and revise how you’ve been spending your time, if necessary. If you’ve lost a really important promotion, a long sought after election, or an end to a relationship, you’re going to feel pain for a really long time. The bigger and more unique the failure, the harder it will be to imagine that you could ever feel better. Very often a big failure leaves you with more time on your hands than you thought you would have. Finding solace in a new interest or self-improvement you’ve always meant to try should be high on your priority list.4.    Re-visit. This is an important step that is both immediate and serves the long term.  On the heels of your great catastrophe, write yourself a letter and be sure to include everything you’re thinking; every pain, every embarrassment, every feeling of loss or shame. Put the letter away. Take it out six months later and evaluate how much these intense feelings of hurt have subsided. Time heals wounds, fades lines in the sand, and opens never-before considered perspectives.5.    Change up your routine to help you find a new normal. However, keep some semblance of order. Make your bed everyday…literally.These steps have helped me more than once. I’m lending them to you because fortunately for the moment I’m not using them (though I’m sure I will again).The goal, forever and always, is to be in a position to learn from failure, for that is its gift. It will lead you to future successes and ultimately help shed the fear that failure often brings.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 10
												GTA: Vice City is set in the most magical time period of the whole Grand Theft Auto series. It has a certain charm that the other games certainly haven't accomplished to the same degree. The soundtrack is one of the most beautiful, and breathtaking soundtracks in all of gaming. The radio commentators are hilarious and witty, and they accompany the music wonderfully. Fernando Martinez from Emotion 98.3 is a prime example of this, constantly commenting about the way he flirts with women, and other things. The gameplay of this game has always been incredibly fun, but to today's standards, it is pretty barren and empty mechanically. There is no cover system, but you can crouch behind things. Weapons shoot in a very curved way if you leave Widescreen turned on. It looks pretty bad on a 16:9 monitor when using widescreen off. The driving is very arcade-y and turning is very rapid and overall works nicely. The city of Miami (Vice City), however, is the main highlight. This is not only one of the most memorable video game maps of all time, it is also... a beautifully remarkable city of pure nostalgia. While it is minuscule in size by comparison to other GTA maps, it sticks with you forever, especially if you played this game for hundreds of hours as a kid. The game makes me feel like I am back at home, which is an extraordinary feeling. While it certainly is a bit short, (took me 10 hours to beat - a bit of a rushed playstyle, and used weapon cheats only). Storywise, it will remind you of classics such as Scarface. This is definitely a recommendation, but I also recommend modding it to bring it a bit more to today's standards.10/10 for the time.

												Grand Theft Auto Vice City has a few ups and downs.The good news is all the ups are in the area of Gameplay which is still amazing and even stands up next to newer games such as GTV V. This game is more simple and arcadey than it's newer siblings which means even though it's not as realistic as the new GTA games it still turns out to be amazing fun in a wonderfully hyper-realised Maimi-ish island.The bad news is that the story mode is very offensive, the radio is sexist, homophobic and just pretty♥♥♥♥♥♥ I know this game is known for being offensive and it's also pretty old now so saying this is offensive is just well, dull. But it's true, a few missions are VERY transphobic and as a trans girl this was pretty♥♥♥♥♥♥My advice, skip the cutscenes and enjoy the game with custom music. It's a blast then.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2014
												I definitely recommend this game, and not only recommend it on all systems, but more specifically on the PC. Reason; I own this game on all sorts of consoles. PC, Xbox, PS2, even iOS and even Android. (I never beaten the iOS and Android ones...) Reason I say the PC one's the best; GAMEPLAY. SO MUCH EASIER. It's because of the manual aim. There is no auto-aim (for those who really want it in this game) but because you have a mouse instead, trust me, it is SO MUCH BETTER. I remember the last level, (specially on the Xbox one, that was my first one) and it was extremely difficult to maneuver with the auto-aim. but with manual, you can just run and shoot, no standing and aiming!!5 outta 5!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												So far, this has been the best grand theft auto.Definitely opened my ears to music that was before my generation. And art. And style. And solid helicopter controls.In the games that improved upon the techological shortcomings of Vice City, they lost other thigns that were much more important. For example: in gta4 they had... no, nevermind bad example. For example: in San Andreas, they had a much more dynamic map with more terrain than vice city had.  In SA, they made a much bigger map and reincluded things like mountains and actual hills. Great additions. They also added things like girlfriend minigames, gang territory, better modeled car suspension, and more interaction with properties, oh and swimming which was a turning point in the series.But what the series slowly lost was that FUN sparkle, the tooty fruity stereotype magic that is felt in things like disney or other cartoons. The gang overarching was cool and all in SanAndreas, but after a while in the game, it brought a seriousness that I did not welcome in Grand Theft Auto. And with the release of GTA4, I think we all should have known something was up. That game lacked all which is enjoyable. It was like windows vista.I've gotten far off topic. What I'm saying is, if you can think about a comparrison to a later (or earlier, actually, huh...) GTA, most likely, the change was either bad overall or pointless.Like most great things, unless you break them down into tiny itsy bitsy little mechanics and details, the only way to describe the greatness of it is to equate it to some unquantifiable magic. In this case, however, I just feel like the over-the-top satire Miami Vice was the PERFECT setting, and I'd like to see GTA6 in the same vein, since with GTA5 it seems like they had a last minute realization, and are slowly working their way back from GTA4.theres a long way to get there, but Rockstar (the developer) is thankfully moving in the right direction. value (for a newcomer with a patience for low poly graphics): 50$Current value (if I needed to play it again and didnt own it): 15$which is saying a lot since I dont often give praise to games. FYI - I played this on ps2, might not be the same experience on pc.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
												One of the best and most unique Grand Theft Auto games. The fact that this one was released a year after GTA III really shows the strength of Rockstar North. No point in explaining the formula, I'm sure most of you know what an open-world game feels like thanks to GTA III's impact. Vice City, however, sticks out to me because of the second half of the game, in which you are allowed to buy any properties that give you missions, expanding on the non-linear nature of the series. If any of this doesn't interest you, then let me tell you that the soundtrack kicks♥♥♥♥♥ boy. The radio stations expanded to a huge size since GTA III, with many diverse stations and commercials that parody the 80s this side of Robocop. TL;DR: BILLIE JEAN IS NOT MY LOVER (brb, reinstalling)

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												If your looking for a review on GTA Vice City you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

												The first thing you'll notice is the same mistakes as GTA3, you'd expect them to fix this by now. The opening videos does not play properly and has to be manually renamed, this could be an issue with Windows 7 only of course. The mouse sensitivity only changes in one axis for some reason, which is stupid. The FPS problems remains. There's not much change in the gameplay from GTA3, there's mostly just new stuff added, a completely new place to roam around in but the same concept remains. I didn't enjoy the story or protagonist as much either, it's just not that memorable, however I thought they improved the gameplay with a lot of small things. content:
Posted: December 12, 2014
												Ah... GTA: Vice City.A PS2 classic, and almost any 90s kid remembers playing this Rated M game on their sibling's console.Spamming all the cheats you could find on that old Windows 98 PC. Hmmm... Nostalgia.This game's graphics were awesome for it's time, and the missions were (Still are... Cough, Cough) a wide range of difficulty. If just for fun, or for the goal of completion, this game is a must have for any gamer, especially GTA fans.This is still my all time favorite GTA with #4 in second and San Andreas in third.I love the voice acing, the racing dynamics, and just all the things you can do in this sandbox-like AI-city atmosphere!10/10 by me, I'd recommend this game to any person who's never played it (Assuming they don't mind the sometimes [often times, lol] inappropriate subject matter).

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												Good game, always loved GTA Vice City. Was the start of the GTA Franchise for me.Funny to think back in the day the graphics were amazing.Controls were a little bit off though. Had difficulty playing initally because my mouse would not work, but switched to windows 98 mode and that fixed that issue. Game play also feels a little bit faster than I remember, but that might only be because it has been so long. My theory was because of the better computer specs it runs a little faster than on the PS2. Found fast cars almost too fast to drive and would take the slower ones. Plus in a shoot out amour and health would go down so fast. Still a great game even with the minor issues, good to play when bored.4/5 for me!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 5
												Despite its aged graphics and somewhat confusing graphics, GTA Vice City is an amazing game that does a very good job at creating a world and atmosphere set in 1986 Miami. A newly released prisoner of 15 years and the main character of the game, Tommy Versetti is the perfect suppliment for this world and your journey through it. The build up to the second half of the game, the characters involved, the game's wonderfully picked set of 80's soundtracks put into radio stations, and the freedom of it all make this a game for anyone interested in the open world genre. As for the graphics, I can't say they're fantastic unless you don't care and enjoy the atmosphere more than graphical fidelity in of itself, but this modpack (which I used through my entire second playthrough) helps with HUD issues, controller support, lighting, etc. It's not essential, but I highly recommend it. 


Grand Theft Auto: Vice City Reborn 
A Guide for Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
By: Qualcom

			Here we are over 10 years later, and Rockstar still hasn't given Grand Theft Auto: Vice City the update it deserves. In this guide we have fixed many bugs from the PC game, and also added some mods to restore things...

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												First off let me start by saying that Rockstar DIDN'T ♥♥♥♥ this one up! Both GTA 3 and San Andreas were absolutely wrecked in the console/PC transition department, but this one seems to actually work fine surprisingly enough. Setting is a load of fun, my personal favorite in the GTA series. Miami in the 1980s. Everything is flashy, everything is bright. The soundtrack is incredible. Honestly I'm not too into stuff from the 80s but this game nails it for me. Not to mention there are more weapons, clothing, and places to visit than in the pervious game. The character of Tommy Vercetti is interesting as well. And, unlike, Claude from GTA 3, he talks quite a bit. The gunplay and the main gameplay is decent. Nothing to write home about by today's standards, but it works. This is more of a game (at least for me) is moreso about cruising around listening to the radio and enjoying the city sights.I'd give it a solid 8/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												Of any game I've ever played I likely have the most nostalgia for this one. This was the video game that got me into gaming. Before this I only casually played videogames whenever I went to a friends. This was the game that made me buy a PS2 and it is the first game I ever 100% completed. There really is no point in listing all of the postives of this masterpiece as I could go on forever. Instead I'll just mention some negatives. -Understandably this game hasn't aged the greatest-Some missions are insanely difficult, so much so that they are not fun at all-I'm spoiled by the newer GTA's ability to swim so that's a continual problem for me at leastHonestly this is one of the few games I can go back to and start all over again without ever feeling bored of it. Seriously, this game is a must play.

content:
Posted: October 6, 2011
												The best GTA ever made, also the one with the best music and the prettiest everything.Vice City is the last GTA with a good actually progressing story (GTA IV is just the tale of Niko ever getting ♥♥♥♥ed and worse off, hated every bit of story in that game) and a decent main character (San Andreas' Carl Johnson is the most obnoxious main character a GTA have ever had).Vice city has a good selection of everything and a story that makes you feel like you are getting somewhere, going from just out of jail mobster with a drug deal ♥♥♥♥ing up and your olf "family" hunting you to starting your own gang and being THE man behind organized crime in the city.
